TEXT.French: Ïîçðàâëÿåì! Âû ïåðâûé ãóáåðíàòîð ñ ïÿòüþ ìîíàñòûðÿìè â Íîâîì Ñâåòå. Áëàãîñëîâåíèå Ãîñïîäíå âîçëÿæåò íà âàñ. Âàø êîðîëü òàêæå ñåãîäíÿ â äîáðîì íàñòðîåíèè.
TEXT.German: Glückwunsch! Ihr habt als erster Gouverneur fünf Abteien in der Neuen Welt errichtet. Gottes Lohn ist Euch gewiss. Aber auch Euer König möchte sich großzügig zeigen.
TEXT.Italian: Congratulations! You are the first governor with five abbayes in the New World. The Lord's blessing will be upon you. Your king is also in a generous mood.
TEXT.Spanish: Congratulations! You are the first governor with five abbayes in the New World. The Lord's blessing will be upon you. Your king is also in a generous mood.

TEXT.English: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.
TEXT.French: Íàïîëíèòå êàçíó êîëîíèè, Âàøå Âûñî÷åñòâî, è ìû äàëüøå áóäåì òâîðèòü äîáðûå äåëà.
TEXT.German: Füllt die Schatzkammern unserer Kolonien, Hoheit, und wir werden weitere gute Werke vollbringen können.
TEXT.Italian: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.
TEXT.Spanish: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.

TEXT.English: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers?
TEXT.French: Êàêàÿ ïîëüçà îò íàøèõ ñîáîðîâ, åñëè ó íàñ íåò îïûòíûõ ïðîïîâåäíèêîâ?
TEXT.German: Was nutzen die schönsten Kathedralen, wenn dort niemand auf der Kanzel steht und das Wort Gottes verkündet?
TEXT.Italian: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers for our new cathedrals?
TEXT.Spanish: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers for our new cathedrals?

TEXT.English: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.
TEXT.French: Ìû îæèäàåì ìíîæåñòâî ïàëîìíèêîâ. Ïîæàëóéñòà ïîìîãèòå íàì ãàðàíòèðóÿ èõ áåçîïàñíîñòü.
TEXT.German: Sicher werden Wallfahrer aus aller Welt anreisen wollen. Bitte helft ihnen bei der Überfahrt.
TEXT.Italian: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.
TEXT.Spanish: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.

TEXT.English: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâüòå ê íàì íåñêîëüêî ïðåñòóïíèêîâ. Ìû íàó÷èì èõ áëàãî÷åñòèâîñòè è òðóäîëþáèþ.
TEXT.German: Ihr wollt uns helfen, Majestät? Nun, vielleicht können wir Euch helfen. Leert Eure Arbeitshäuser und expediert das Gesindel in die Kolonien. Wir werden ihm Frömmigkeit und Ehrbarkeit einbläuen. Ora et labora!
TEXT.Italian: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.
TEXT.Spanish: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.

TEXT.English: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?
TEXT.French: Ó íàñ ñëèøêîì ìíîãî åðåòèêîâ. Íå ìîãëè áû âû ïðèñëàòü íåìíîãî ñîëäàò, äàáû âåðíóòü èõ íà ïóòü ïðàâåäíûé?
TEXT.German: Das Leben in den Kolonien ist beschwerlich und hat viele kaltherzig werden lassen. So mancher raue Gesell murrt, der Prunk der Gotteshäuser sei Verschwendung und jeder Pfaffe ein Schmarotzer. Schickt uns ein paar harte Burschen, um diesen Ketzern Frömmigkeit einzubleuen!
TEXT.Italian: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?
TEXT.Spanish: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?

TEXT.English: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?
TEXT.French: Âû ïîñòðîèëè ñâîé ïåðâûé ìåòàëóðãè÷åñêèé çàâîä. Îòëè÷íî! Íî ðàçâå ýòîãî äîñòàòî÷íî?
TEXT.German: Eine Abordnung der Handwerkergilden wird bei Euch vorstellig. Die Meister loben Eure Tatkraft, eine Schmiedemanufaktur errichtet zu haben, in der Eisenwaren in großen Mengen hergestellt werden können. Doch wüchse die Nachfrage an Nägeln und Nieten, Bolzen und Beilen, Schellen und Schrauben noch weiter an. Die Entwicklung der Kolonien hinge maßgeblich davon ab, diesen Bedarf zu decken. Demütig unterbreitet man Euch die Idee, an zentraler Stelle eine Fabrik zu errichten, größer als alle anderen, die die Neue Welt bisher gesehen hat.
TEXT.Italian: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?
TEXT.Spanish: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?

TEXT.English: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.French: Ïîñòðîéòå áîëüøîé èíñòðóìåíòàëüíûé çàâîä. Âàøè ãîðîæàíå áóäóò ïðèçíàòåëüíû.
TEXT.German: Eine Vision nach meinem Geschmack! Wohlan, ich werde diese Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichten lassen, als erste Produktionsstätte dieser Art in Amerika. Natürlich erwarte ich, dass die Handwerkerschaft dieses Engagement honorieren wird ...
TEXT.Italian: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.

TEXT.English: Oh no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!
TEXT.French: Î íåò! Äðóãîé ãóáåðíàòîð óæå ïîñòðîèë áîëüøîé èíñòðóìåíòàëüíûé çàâîä. Íàì íèêîãäà íå íàñëàäèòüñÿ ïåðâåíñòâîì!
TEXT.German: Ein anderer Gouverneur hat als erster eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichtet. Rechnet nicht mehr mit einer Belohnung, wenn Ihr gleichzieht.
TEXT.Italian: O no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!
TEXT.Spanish: O no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!

TEXT.English: Somebody has built a great tool factory.
TEXT.French: Êòî-òî ïîñòðîèë áîëüøîé èíñòðóìåíòàëüíûé çàâîä.
TEXT.German: Eine Nation hat eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Somebody has built a great tool factory.
TEXT.Spanish: Somebody has built a great tool factory.

TEXT.English: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.
TEXT.French: Ïîçäðàâëÿåì! Âû ïåðâûé ãóáåðíàòîð ñ áîëüøèì èíñòðóìåíòàëüíûì çàâîäîì. Âàøè ãîðîæàíå èñêðåííå áëàãîäàðÿò âàñ.
TEXT.German: Welch erstaunliche Leistung! Ihr habt als erster Gouverneur eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik in der Neuen Welt errichtet. Die Handwerkergilden fühlen sich Euch zu Dank verpflichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.

TEXT.English: Cash is king ...
TEXT.French: Äåíüãè ýòî êîðîëü ...
TEXT.German: Nur Bares ist Wahres ...
TEXT.Italian: Cash is king ...
TEXT.Spanish: Cash is king ...

TEXT.English: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guildmasters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.French: Ïî÷åìó íåò - ÿ ëèøü ñëóæó íàøåìó îáùåñòâó. Óâåðåí, ãëàâû ãèëüäèé òàêæå íå ëèøåíû ïàòðèîòè÷åñêîãî âäîõíîâåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Man muss mir nicht danken - ich danke der Bürgerschaft! Dafür, dass ich als Staatsmann unserem Gemeinwesen dienen darf. Ich bin mir sicher, dass die Gildenführer derselbe patriotische Geist beflügelt!
TEXT.Italian: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.Spanish: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.

TEXT.English: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.French: Íàì íóæíû êâàëèôèöèðîâàííûå êóçíåöû íà íîâóþ ôàáðèêó.
TEXT.German: Jetzt gilt es, die große Fabrikhalle mit Leben zu füllen. Die Zunftmeister sollen ihre tüchtigsten Söhne fürs Schmiedehandwerk zur Verfügung stellen!
TEXT.Italian: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.Spanish: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.

TEXT.English: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.French: Íîâûé çàâîä ñòàíåò âàæíîé ÷àñòüþ íàøåé âîåííîé ïðîìûøëåííîñòè. Äàéòå ðàáî÷èì óíèôîðìó!
TEXT.German: Diese Fabrik wird nicht nur unsere zivile Wirtschaft zum Brummen bringen, sondern auch die Fertigung kriegswichtiger Güter ankurbeln. Lasst die Arbeiter in Uniform an den Werkbänken ihren Dienst verrichten! Die Welt soll wissen, dass wir eine wehrhafte junge Nation sind.
TEXT.Italian: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!

TEXT.English: A foreign emissary from the Russian court has arrived at your capitol.
TEXT.French: Èíîñòðàííûé ïîñîë èç Ðîññèè ïðèáûë â âàøó ñòîëèöó.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, beim Richtfest Eures Arsenals zieht Euch ein fremdartig gekleideter Ausländer beiseite. Er spricht Eure Muttersprache, doch mit einem fürchterlichen Akzent. Der Mann behauptet, im Auftrag eines russischen Fürsten zu handeln, der gerne mit der stärksten Wirtschaftsmacht der Neuen Welt ins Geschäft kommen möchte.
TEXT.Italian: A foreign businessman is visiting your colonies. He says that he is a transactor of a Russian sovereign.
TEXT.Spanish: A foreign businessman is visiting your colonies. He says that he is a transactor of a Russian sovereign.

TEXT.English: The emissary promises you a deal of great advantage if your nation will be the first to build a great arsenal in the New World.
TEXT.French: Ïîñîë îáåùàåò âàì òåñíîå è âûãîäíîå ñîòðóäíè÷åñòâî, åñëè âàø íàðîä ïåðâûì ïîñòðîèò áîëüøîé àðñåíàë â Íîâîì Ñâåòå.
TEXT.German: Falls Eure Kolonie die erste sei, die in Amerika ein Großes Zeughaus errichte, könne Euch ein interessantes Geschäft vermittelt werden, kündigt der Unterhändler an. Zum Richtfest des Großen Zeughauses komme er wieder, und es sei ratsam, dann etwas Gold zur Verfügung zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.
TEXT.Spanish: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.

TEXT.English: Another governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessman will give the promised rewards to him.
TEXT.French: Äðóãîé ãóáåðíàòîð ïîñòðîèë áîëüøîé àðñåíàë. Èíîñòðàííûé äåëåö ïðåäîñòàâèò îáåùàííóþ íàãðàäó åìó.
TEXT.German: Ein anderer Gouverneur hat als erster ein Großes Zeughaus errichtet und das Geschäft mit dem russischen Fürsten abschließen können. Schade!
TEXT.Italian: Another American governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessmen will give the promised gratification to him.
TEXT.Spanish: Another American governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessmen will give the promised gratification to him.

TEXT.English: Somebody has built a great arsenal.
TEXT.French: Êòî-òî ïîñòðîèë áîëüøîé àðñåíàë.
TEXT.German: Eine Nation hat ein Großes Zeughaus errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Somebody has built a great arsenal.
TEXT.Spanish: Somebody has built a great arsenal.

TEXT.English: Governor, you are the first to build a great arsenal. A foreign emissary from the court of the great Tsar of All the Russias offers you an interesting deal..
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, âû ïåðâûì ïîñòðîèëè áîëüøîé àðñåíàë. Ïîñîë, îò äâîðà âåëèêîãî Öàðÿ Âñåÿ Ðóñè, ïðåäëàãàåò âàì èíòåðåñíóþ ñäåëêó..
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, Ihr habt als erster in der Neuen Welt ein Großes Zeughaus errichten können. Wie versprochen, taucht zum Richtfest der ominöse ausländische Geschäftsmann wieder auf, der vorgibt, im Auftrag eines russischen Fürsten zu handeln. Immer noch spricht der Unterhändler Eure Muttersprache mit furchtbarem Akzent. Ihr nehmt Euch vor, ihm den Hauslehrer Eurer Neffen, Herrn Berlitz, zu empfehlen, der bei der Spracherziehung der Tunichtgute wahre Wunder wirkte. Doch zuvor bittet Ihr den Fremden, die Angebote des Fürsten vorzutragen.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, you are the first one who manages to build a great arsenal. The foreign businessman, speaking for a Russian sovereign, offers you an interesting deal.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, you are the first one who manages to build a great arsenal. The foreign businessman, speaking for a Russian sovereign, offers you an interesting deal.

TEXT.English: Competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.French: Îïûòíûå îðóæåéíèêè è Ñàíêò-Ïåòåðáóðãà ìîãóò ïðèåõàòü â Àìåðèêó è ðàáîòàòü íà âàñ.
TEXT.German: Zwei meisterhafte Waffenschmiede aus Sankt Petersburg können in die Neue Welt kommen, bietet Euch der Unterhändler an. Famos!
TEXT.Italian: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.

TEXT.English: Soon the Russian sovereign is to marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of certain young valets and assure their discretion.
TEXT.French: Âñêîðå ðîññèéñêèé ãîñóäàðü äîëæåí æåíèòüñÿ íà äî÷åðè ïðóññêîãî êîðîëÿ. Ñåé÷àñ æå îí õî÷åò èçáàâèòüñÿ îò íåêîòîðûõ ìîëîäûõ ëàêååâ, äàáû íàáðàòü íîâûõ íà ñâîå óñìîòðåíèå .
TEXT.German: Der russische Fürst heiratet in Bälde die Tochter des preußischen Königs. Vorab würde er gerne diskret einige junge Kammerdiener loswerden, deren Zutraulichkeiten jetzt nicht mehr erwünscht sind. Nun denn!
TEXT.Italian: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.
TEXT.Spanish: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.

TEXT.English: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awe-inspiring.
TEXT.French: Ðîññèéñêèé ãîñóäàðü ìîæåò ïðèêàçàòü åãî ïîñëàì, ïðè Åâðîïåéñêèé êîðîëåâñêèõ äâîðàõ, ñîîáùèòü ÷òî âàø áîëüøîé àðñåíàë âïå÷àòëÿåò.
TEXT.German: Der Fürst könne über seine Gesandten an den europäischen Höfen die Kunde verbreiten lassen, wie beeindruckend Euer Zeughaus sei und dass es selbst dem in Moskau fast gleichkomme. Das klingt schmeichelhaft!
TEXT.Italian: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.
TEXT.Spanish: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.

TEXT.English: This man seems to be a common hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change him into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.French: Ýòîò ÷åëîâåê èìååò ìíîãî îáùåãî ñ ïîäïîëüíûìè äåëüöàìè. Íå ñòîèò ïðåäïðèíèìàòü ðåçêèõ øàãîâ ÷òîáû ñäåëàòü èç íåãî ÷åñòíîãî ãðàæäàíèíà. Îí ìîæåò íàáèâàòü ñâîé êîøåëåê è ñîâàòü íîñ â ÷óæèå äåëà îäíîâðåìåííî.
TEXT.German: Je länger der Unterhändler redet, desto halbseidener klingen seine Offerten. Euer Herz sagt Euch, dass dieser Mann ein Nepper ist, ein Schlepper, ein Bauernfänger! Ihr heißt Eure Gardisten, dem Gauner die Geldbörse abzunehmen und ihn zu hartem, aber ehrlichen Tagewerk zu zwingen.
TEXT.Italian: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.Spanish: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.
TEXT.French: Íà ñêëàä â %s2_city áûë ñîâåðøåí ðåéä.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde überfallen.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of looting a cartload of rum.
TEXT.French: Íà ñêëàä â %s2_city áûë ñîâåðøåí ðåéä. Íàøè %s1_civ ñîñåäè â %s6_city ïîäîçðåâàþòñÿ â ãðàáåæå è âûâîçå ðîìà.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde überfallen und ausgeraubt. Unsere %s1_civ Nachbarn in %s6_city werden verdächtigt, den Überfall begangen und die Ladung Rum geraubt zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of the raid and looting a cartload of rum.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of the raid and looting a cartload of rum.

TEXT.English: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.French: Ðàçðàçè ìåíÿ ãðîì! Äàâíî æå ÿ íå âèäåë òàêîãî ïüÿíñòâà! Ïóñòü îñòàâÿò ðîì ñåáå, àëêîãîëèçì â íàøåé êîëîíèè áåñïîêîèò ìåíÿ ñèëüíåå.
TEXT.German: Potzblitz! Solche Schnapsnasen sind mir lange nicht mehr untergekommen. Lasst ihnen den Rum, es wurde sowieso Zeit gegen die Trunkenheit in unserer Kolonie vorzugehen.
TEXT.Italian: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.

TEXT.English: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running low on rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.French: Íàøè ãðóç÷èêè è ìàòðîñû âçáóíòóþòñÿ åñëè ðîì âäðóã çàêîí÷èòñÿ. Îñòàíîâèòå èõ! Çà îðóæèå!
TEXT.German: Die Werftarbeiter und Matrosen werden meutern, wenn der Schnaps ausgeht. Haltet sie auf! Zu den Waffen, Männer!
TEXT.Italian: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!

TEXT.English: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.French: Áûë óêðàäåí òîëüêî ðîì? Íèêòî íå ïîñòðàäàë? Îòïðàâüòå ãðàáèòåëÿì åùå ðîìà, íè ê ÷åìó ýòè ïðåäñòàâëåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Sie haben nur den Rum gestohlen? Niemand wurde verletzt? Schickt ihnen noch eine zusätzliche Ladung, das wird sich noch für uns auszahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.Spanish: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.

TEXT.English: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.French: Íàøè %s1_civ ñîñåäè âåñüìà ïðèçíàòåëüíû çà äîñòàâêó ðîìà.
TEXT.German: Unsere %s1_civ Nachbarn zeigen sich erkenntlich für den Rum.
TEXT.Italian: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.Spanish: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.

TEXT.English: Governor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, ðóèíû âîçëå %s2_city íèêîãäà íå áûëè èçó÷åíû äîëæíûì îáðàçîì. Âàøè ñîâåòíèêè ðåêîìåíäóþò îòïðàâèòü ýêñïåäèöèþ.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, die Ruinen nahe %s2_city sind bis heute nicht gründlich untersucht worden. Eure Berater empfehlen eine Expedition zu entsenden.
TEXT.Italian: Gouvernor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.
TEXT.Spanish: Gouvernor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: %s1_civ_adjective ýêñïåäèöèÿ íà÷àëà ñâîè ïîèñêè, â ðàçâàëèíàõ âîçëå %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Eine %s1:3_civ_adjective Expedition bricht in die Ruinen nahe %s2_city auf.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without one!
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâèòü íàøèõ ñàìûõ îïûòíûõ ðàçâåä÷èêîâ! Èõ æäåò áîãàòñòâî è ñëàâà, åñëè îíè ñäåëàþò öåííîå îòêðûòèå. È ïîâåðüòå ìíå, èì ëó÷øå íå âîçâðàùàòüñÿ áåç íåãî!
TEXT.German: Schickt unsere erfahrensten Späher! Reichtum und Ehre erwartet die Männer, wenn sie wertvolle Entdeckungen machen. Und glaubt mir, sie sollten besser nicht ohne eine Entdeckung zurückkommen!
TEXT.Italian: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!
TEXT.Spanish: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!

TEXT.English: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâèòü þíèò [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] â ðóèíû áëèç %s2_city íà %d3 õîäà.
TEXT.German: Schickt innerhalb von %d3 Runden eine Einheit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] in die Ruine nahe %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.
TEXT.Spanish: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.

TEXT.English: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.
TEXT.French: Ê ñîæàëåíèþ, âàøà ýêñïåäèöèÿ óæå íå ñìîæåò èññëåäîâàòü ðóèíû.
TEXT.German: Leider kann die Ruine von Eurer Expedition nicht mehr erkundet werden.
TEXT.Italian: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.
TEXT.Spanish: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.

TEXT.English: Governor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, íàøà ýêñïåäèöèÿ ïðèáûëà â ðàçâàëèíû. Íà ÷åì èì ñîñðåäîòî÷èòüñÿ?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, unsere Expedition hat die Ruinen erreicht. Wonach sollen unsere Männer suchen?
TEXT.Italian: Gouvernor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?
TEXT.Spanish: Gouvernor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?

TEXT.English: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.French: Èññëåäîâàòåëè êîðîëåâñêîé àêàäåìèè íàóê, îæèäàþò áîëåå ïîäðîáíîé èíôîðìàöèè î äèêàðÿõ â íàøåì ðåãèîíå. Ïóñòü ëþäè èùóò ÷òî-òî èç íàñëåäèÿ àáîðèãåíîâ.
TEXT.German: Bei Hofe erwartet man sich weitere Erkenntnisse über die Wilden. Lasst nach ihren Hinterlassenschaften suchen! Insbesondere die geheimnisvolle Knotenschrift hat es unseren Forschern angetan.
TEXT.Italian: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.Spanish: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.

TEXT.English: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü èùóò êàêîå-òî áàðàõëî, ïîñìîòðèì ÷òî ñ íèì ìîæíî ñäåëàòü.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie die Schrotthaufen nach etwas Verwertbarem durchsuchen.
TEXT.Italian: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.

TEXT.English: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.French: Ìîé äâîðåö íóæäàåòñÿ â ðåìîíòå. Ïóñòü èùóò ñîêðîâèùà!
TEXT.German: Mein Palast müsste dringend renoviert werden. Lasst sie nach Schätzen suchen!
TEXT.Italian: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.Spanish: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!

TEXT.English: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Óñïåøíàÿ %s1_civ_adjective ýêñïåäèöèÿ âîçâðàùàåòñÿ èç ðóèí áëèç %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die %s1:3_civ_adjective Expedition kehrt erfolgreich aus den Ruinen nahe %s2_city zurück!
TEXT.Italian: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.
TEXT.French: %s1_civ_adjective îïûòíûé ïëîòíèê æåëàåò ÷òîáû åãî ïîñåòèëà ñåìüÿ èç Åâðîïû.
TEXT.German: Ein %s1:4_civ_adjective Meisterzimmermann möchte seine Familie in die Neue Welt nachkommen lassen.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.

TEXT.English: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.
TEXT.French: Îïûòíûé ïëîòíèê õî÷åò îòïðàâèòü ïèñüìî ñâîåé ñåìüå â Åâðîïó, è ðàññêàçàòü èì, êàê ïðåêðàñåí Íîâûé Ñâåò. Ãóáåðíàòîð, îí ïðîñèò âàñ äàòü åìó äåíåã, íà ïðîåçä îäíîãî èç åãî áðàòüåâ.
TEXT.German: Ein Meisterzimmermann will seiner Familie in der Heimat schreiben, wie sehr ihm das Leben in der Neuen Welt gefällt. Er fragt Euch, Herr Gouverneur, ob Ihr ihm etwas Geld geben möchtet. Er würde es seinen Angehörigen schicken, damit einer seiner Brüder in die Neue Welt nachkommen kann.
TEXT.Italian: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.
TEXT.Spanish: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.

TEXT.English: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.
TEXT.French: Êîíå÷íî! Åãî ñòàðøèé áðàò - êóçíåö, äîáðî ïîæàëîâàòü .
TEXT.German: Aber sicher doch! Sein älterer Bruder, der Schmied, wäre hier gerne gesehen.
TEXT.Italian: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.
TEXT.Spanish: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.

TEXT.English: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.
TEXT.French: Âîçìîæíî åãî ìëàäøèé áðàò, êðåñòüÿíèí â óñàäüáå åãî ðîäèòåëåé, ñîáëàãîâîëèò ïðèåõàòü.
TEXT.German: Vielleicht möchte sein jüngerer Bruder, der noch auf dem elterlichen Hof arbeitet, nach Amerika kommen?
TEXT.Italian: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.

TEXT.English: As I recall his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage..
TEXT.French: Íàñêîëüêî ÿ ïîìíþ åãî äâîþðîäíûé áðàò â áåãàõ, çà áðàêîíüåðñòâî. Íå õîòåë áû îí ïðèåõàòü? Ïðàâäà ÿ íå ñìîãó îïëàòèòü åãî ïðèåçä..
TEXT.German: Wurde sein Vetter nicht vom Landbüttel daheim als Wilderer gesucht? Nun, er kann hier gerne ein neues Leben anfangen. Für die Überfahrt hat er aber selber aufzukommen.
TEXT.Italian: I remember that his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage.
TEXT.Spanish: I remember that his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen near %s2_city has proclaimed that an angel has revealed to him the sacred Book of Mormon.
TEXT.French: %s1_civ_adjective ãðàæäàíèí âîçëå %s2_city îáüÿâèë, ÷òî àíãåë îòêðûë åìó ñâÿùåííóþ Êíèãó Ìîðìîíà.
TEXT.German: Im %s1:2_civ_adjective Reich behauptet ein Mann, ein Engel hätte ihm nahe der Stadt %s2_city das Buch Mormon überreicht.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen proclaims, that an angel has given the Book of Mormon to him near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen proclaims, that an angel has given the Book of Mormon to him near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A man proclaims that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has revealed a holy book inscribed on plates of silver. The news is spreading like wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?
TEXT.French: Ìóæ÷èíà ïðîâîçãëàñèë,÷òî â ïóñòûíå âîçëå %s2_city, àíãåë ðàñêðûë ïðåä íèì ñâÿùåííóþ êíèãó íàïèñàííóþ íà ñåðåáðÿíûõ ïëàñòèíàõ. Íîâîñòü ðàñïðîñòðàíèëàñü ïî íàøåé êîëîíèè êàê ëåñíîé ïîæàð, ïî÷òè âñå æèòåëè ãîðîäà ïîâåðèëè åìó, è â ýòó òàê íàçûâàåìóþ Êíèãó Ìîðìîíà. ×òî íàì äåëàòü?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Ein Mann behauptet, ein Engel hätte ihm in der Wüste nahe der Stadt %s2_city eine heilige Schrift überreicht.[NEWLINE]Die Nachricht verbreitet sich wie ein Lauffeuer, fast alle Stadtbewohner folgen ihm und diesem Buch Mormon bereits. Was sollen wir tun?
TEXT.Italian: Governor, a man proclaims, that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has given a holy book to him. The news is spreading like a wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city do believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, a man proclaims, that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has given a holy book to him. The news is spreading like a wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city do believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?

TEXT.English: Blasphemy! The hot sun seems to have addled his mind! Quickly, raise a tithe from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need God's help.
TEXT.French: Êîùóíñòâî! Ïîõîæå æàðà ïîâðåäèëà åãî ðàññóäîê! Áûñòðî, ñîáðàòü äåñÿòèíó ñî âñåõ áîãîáîÿçíåííûõ ãðàæäàí è îòïðàâèòü ìèññèîíåðà â ýòîò ãîðîä! Ïîòåðÿííûå äóøè íóæäàþòñÿ â Áîæüåé ïîìîùè.
TEXT.German: Dem hat die Wüstensonne wohl das Hirn verdorrt! Rasch, sammelt Geld von den gottesfürchtigen Bürgern und schickt einen Missionar in die Stadt! Die verirrten Seelen brauchen unsere Hilfe.
TEXT.Italian: The hot sun seems to have toasted his mind! Quick, collect some monex from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need our help.
TEXT.Spanish: The hot sun seems to have toasted his mind! Quick, collect some monex from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need our help.

TEXT.English: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. To each his own faith, as long as they pay their taxes ...
TEXT.French: Íå îñòàíàâëèâàéòå åãî, ïóòè Ãîñïîäà íåèñïîâåäèìû. Ïóñòü êàæäûé âåðèò âî ÷òî õî÷åò, ïîêà ïëàòèò íàëîãè ...
TEXT.German: Lasst ihn gewähren, Gottes Wege sind unergründlich. Ein jeder mag seinen Glauben leben, wie es ihm beliebt, solange er seine Steuern zahlt ...
TEXT.Italian: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. Everybody may live his faith, as wanted, as long as they pay their taxes ...
TEXT.Spanish: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. Everybody may live his faith, as wanted, as long as they pay their taxes ...

TEXT.English: Hallelujah, we truly do live in Gods own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.
TEXT.French: Hallelujah, we truly do live in Gods own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.
TEXT.German: Halleluja, wir leben wahrhaft in Gottes Reich auf Erden! Unterstützt diesen Propheten, so gut es geht. Ich sehe schon blühende Landschaften in der Wüste entstehen.
TEXT.Italian: Hallelujah, we truly do live in Gods own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.
TEXT.Spanish: Hallelujah, we truly do live in Gods own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.

TEXT.English: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Áóíò âî %s1_civ_adjective êîëîíèÿõ, à èìåííî â %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Das %s1:3_civ_adjective Kolonialreich wird von Protesten treuer Royalisten erschüttert, sie gehen in %s2_city auf die Straße!
TEXT.Italian: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Governor, certain prominent citizens of %s2_city are protesting that you are not truly loyal to the sovereign. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, âèäíûå ãîðîæàíå %s2_city ïðîòåñòóþò, óòâåðæäàÿ ÷òî âû íåäîñòàòî÷íî ïðåäàííû ãîñóäàðþ. Âàì ñòîèò êàê-òî îòðåàãèðîâàòü íå çàáûâàÿ î ïîñëåäñòâèÿõ!
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Ein guter Teil der Bürger in %s2_city zieht protestierend in Richtung des örtlichen Regierungspalastes. Sie werfen Euch vor, dass Ihr unserem König nicht mehr loyal seid, einige bezichtigen Euch gar des Separatismus! Ihr müsst etwas tun, doch bedenkt, dass es Folgen haben könnte ...
TEXT.Italian: Governor, some of the citizens in %s2_city are protesting. They proclaim, that you are not loyal to the king anymore. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, some of the citizens in %s2_city are protesting. They proclaim, that you are not loyal to the king anymore. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!

TEXT.English: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse..
TEXT.French: Ïðèâåäèòå êî ìíå èõ ãëàâíîãî è ïîäíèìèòå êîðîëåâñêèå ôëàãè. ×åñòíûé ðàçãîâîð ìåæäó äâóìÿ äæåíòåëüìåíàìè è áîêàë âèíà äîëæíû âñå ïðîÿñíèòü. ß ñäåëàþ åìó ïðåäëîæåíèå îò êîòîðîãî îí íå ñìîæåò îòêàçàòüñÿ..
TEXT.German: Holt mir den führenden Kopf hierher und hängt noch zwei königliche Banner aus dem Fenster. Ein guter Schluck Wein und ein offenes Gespräch haben schon so manche Bluttat verhindert. Ich werde ihm ein Angebot machen, dass er nicht ablehnen kann.
TEXT.Italian: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.
TEXT.Spanish: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.

TEXT.English: ... maybe even the King will hear of your good manners ...
TEXT.French: ... âîçìîæíî äàæå Êîðîëü, óçíàåò î âàøèõ õîðîøèõ ìàíåðàõ ...
TEXT.German: ... von solch wohlfeilem Gebaren könnte sogar der König erfahren ...
TEXT.Italian: ... maybe even the king will hear of your good manners ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... maybe even the king will hear of your good manners ...

TEXT.English: Let them talk! Freedom of speech and conscience for every man, that is our watchword.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü ãîâîðÿò! Ñâîáîäà ñëîâà è ñîâåñòè êàæäîãî ÷åëîâåêà - ýòî íàø äåâèç.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie gewähren, der wache Geist und das freie Wort waren mir stets teuer. Ich unterdrücke sie nicht, sagt ihnen das. Sie sind hier mindestens so frei, ihre unverbrüchliche Königsliebe zu leben, wie in unserem Mutterland.
TEXT.Italian: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I wont opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I wont opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.

TEXT.English: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...
TEXT.French: ... ïîäîáíûå ðàçãîâîðû ìîãóò ïðèâåñòè ê îïðåäåëåííîãî ðîäà íåïðèÿòíîñòÿì ...
TEXT.German: ... dieses royalistische Palaver könnte uns noch zu schaffen machen ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...

TEXT.English: Let our brave troops disperse them, but press them no further! I will not see blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü íàøè õðàáðûå âîéñêà ðàçãîíÿò èõ, íî áåç èçëèøåñòâ! ß íå ïîòåðïëþ ïðîëèòîé êðîâè íà óëèöàõ íàøèõ ãîðîäîâ.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Truppen diesen Haufen auflösen, mit diesen Hitzköpfen lässt sich einfach nicht diskutieren ... Ich will aber kein Blutvergießen, also denkt daran, zur Not nutzt den Gewehrkolben, aber dass mir kein Schuss fällt!
TEXT.Italian: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I dont want any blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.Spanish: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I dont want any blood spilled in our streets.

TEXT.English: ... this could make them even more angry ...
TEXT.French: ... ýòî ìîæåò ñäåëàòü èõ åùå çëåå ...
TEXT.German: ... das wird für Groll und Wut sorgen, die Königstreuen könnten uns noch einen Denkzettel verpassen ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this acting could make them even more angry ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this acting could make them even more angry ...

TEXT.English: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, lest they seize us from behind later.
TEXT.French: Ïåðåñòðåëÿéòå èõ, à âûæèâøèõ èçãîíèòå! Ëó÷øå èçáàâèòüñÿ îò ýòîé ìðàçè ñåé÷àñ, ÷òîáû íå óïóñòèòü âðåìÿ.
TEXT.German: Kartätscht dieses Pack zusammen, enteignet sie, jagt sie aus der Stadt! Besser wir bereinigen die Sache jetzt schnell und gründlich, als dass sie uns später in den Rücken fallen ...
TEXT.Italian: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.
TEXT.Spanish: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.

TEXT.English: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...
TEXT.French: ... ýòî ñëîæíîå ðåøåíèå, îíè îïðåäåëåííî áóäóò ìñòèòü ...
TEXT.German: ... ein heikler Schritt, die Lumpen werden sicher Rache üben ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective King sends a gift to his loyal governor.
TEXT.French: %s1_civ_adjective êîðîëü îòïðàâëÿåò ïîäàðîê ñâîåìó âåðíîìó ãóáåðíàòîðó.
TEXT.German: Der %s1:3_civ_adjective König zeigt sich gegenüber seinem treuen Gouverneur erkenntlich.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective king sends a gift to his loyal governor.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective king sends a gift to his loyal governor.

TEXT.English: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His Highness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life along with best regards.
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, ïîõîæå âàøå ''áåçîòêàçíîå'' ïðåäëîæåíèå ïîâëèÿëî êëþ÷åâûì îáðàçîì íà êîðîëåâñêîå ðåøåíèå. Åãî Âûñî÷åñòâî ïîñûëàåò äâóõ ñâîèõ ëó÷øèõ ëþäåé, ÷òîáû çàùèòèòü âàøó æèçíü, âìåñòå ñ íàèëó÷øèìè ïîæåëàíèÿìè.
TEXT.German: Es scheint, Gouverneur, dass Eure aufrichtigen Bemühungen um die königstreuen Bürger von %s2_city sogar am entfernten Hofe Eindruck schinden. Mit den besten Grüßen schickt Euch ihre königliche Hoheit zwei erlesene Soldaten als Leibwache.
TEXT.Italian: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His higness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life alog with best regards.
TEXT.Spanish: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His higness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life alog with best regards.

TEXT.English: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.
TEXT.French: Âî %s1_civ_adjective êîëîíèÿõ ðîÿëèñòû ñîçäàþò ïðîáëåìû.
TEXT.German: Überall im %s1:2_civ_adjective Kolonialreich begehren die Royalisten auf.
TEXT.Italian: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.
TEXT.Spanish: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.

TEXT.English: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.
TEXT.French: Ãóáåðíàòîð, ðîÿëèñòû ïîõîæå ðåøèëè âîñïîëüçîâàòüñÿ ñâîáîäîé ñëîâà. Îíè ÿâëÿþòñÿ îñíîâàòåëÿìè êëóáîâ è ëîæ ïîâñþäó. Íà äàííûé ìîìåíò ýòî ïðîáëåìà òîëüêî â êðóïíûõ ãîðîäàõ, â ñåëüñêîé ìåñòíîñòè èõ íå áûëî è íåò.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Die Königstreuen scheinen von ihrem Recht auf freie Rede regen Gebrauch zu machen. Es bilden sich überall Logen und Clubs. Gerade die großen kulturellen Zentren des Landes scheinen diesen patriotischen Tendenzen anheim zu fallen. Unter der einfachen Bevölkerung auf dem Lande finden dererlei Grillen noch keinen Anklang.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.

TEXT.English: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.
TEXT.French: Ðîÿëèñòû èñïîðòèëè óíè÷òîæèëè ïèùó âî %s1_civ_adjective êîëîíèÿõ.
TEXT.German: Royalisten haben in den %s1:2_civ_adjective Städten Nahrung vernichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.

TEXT.English: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.
TEXT.French: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Die Königstreuen haben uns übel mitgespielt. Sie haben in allen Städten die Kornspeicher besetzt und begonnen, das Getreide und alles andere Essbare zu vernichten. Vielerorts beteiligten sich brave Leute an diesem Frevel, weil es hieß, es wäre Eure Order! Auf getürkten Anschlägen stand zu lesen: "Aufgrund der unverschämt hohen Steuern ist es erste Bürgerpflicht, sich dem König zu widersetzen! Vernichtet aus Protest alle Nahrungsmittel in allen Städten!"
TEXT.Italian: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.

TEXT.English: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Ðîÿëèñòû âçîðâàëè ãàçåòíóþ ðåäàêöèþ âî %s1_civ_adjective ãîðîäå %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Royalisten haben in der %s3_civ_adjective Stadt %s2_city die Zeitung gesprengt!
TEXT.Italian: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...
TEXT.French: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! GOUVERNEUR ! In %s2_city wurde die Zeitung in die Luft gejagt. Eine versprengte Gruppe Royalisten hat wohl Rache genommen. An einer Wirtshauswand in der Nähe stand in großen Lettern: "Es lebe der König!", unterzeichnet von einem gewissen Sir Sekwaf Yug. Es scheint ein Tarnname zu sein, so heißt doch kein ...
TEXT.Italian: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...

TEXT.English: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.
TEXT.French: Îíè âûãëÿäÿò ìîëîäöàìè! Ïóñòü îõðàíÿþò ìîþ êðîâàòü ñ ýòîãî äíÿ, ñ íèìè ìíå áóäåò ëó÷øå ñïàòüñÿ.
TEXT.German: Das sind wahrlich stramme Kerls, mein Leib und Leben scheint mir bei ihnen in guten Händen. Postiert sie zu beiden Seiten des Bettes, auf dass mein Schlummer friedlich bleiben möge.
TEXT.Italian: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.
TEXT.Spanish: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.

TEXT.English: Dont bother me again with these powdered fops! They give me a headache.
TEXT.French: Dont bother me again with these powdered fops! They give me a headache.
TEXT.German: Davon kriege ich Kopfschmerzen, bitte, belästigt mich nicht weiter mit diesen gepuderten Affenhirnen.
TEXT.Italian: Dont bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.
TEXT.Spanish: Dont bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.

TEXT.English: The will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...
TEXT.French: Âîëÿ ê ðåâîëþöèè ïàäàåò, ïî êðàéíåé ìåðå â êðóïíûõ ãîðîäàõ ...
TEXT.German: ... die revolutionäre Begeisterung lässt nach, aber wenigstens nur in den großen Städten ...
TEXT.Italian: ... the will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... the will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...

TEXT.English: A hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, thats all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" gives me another idea..
TEXT.French: A hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, thats all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" gives me another idea..
TEXT.German: Ein teuflischer Plan, diese Hunde, rettet, was zu retten ist ... allein, der Wortlaut dieses Anschlages kommt mir wirklich bekannt vor.
TEXT.Italian: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, thats all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.
TEXT.Spanish: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, thats all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.

TEXT.English: Sheer perfidy! Theyve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, I will find him!
TEXT.French: Sheer perfidy! Theyve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, I will find him!
TEXT.German: WAS ZUM TEUFEL? Oh, diese Barbaren, durchsucht die Stadt, durchstöbert die Wälder, durchkämmt die Wüsten! Ich werde diesen, diesen ... na wie auch immer er heißt, kriegen!
TEXT.Italian: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, theyve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!
TEXT.Spanish: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, theyve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!

TEXT.English: The amount of gold and other treasure that is carried through our cities is getting attention, perhaps too much attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.
TEXT.French: Êîëè÷åñòâî çîëîòà è äðóãèõ ñîêðîâèù, êîòîðûå ïðîâîçÿòñÿ ÷åðåç íàøè ãîðîäà, âûçûâàåò ñëèøêîì ìíîãî âíèìàíèÿ! Âàøè ãðàæäàíå ìîãóò ïîääàòüñÿ ñîáëàçíó.
TEXT.German: Der Reichtum dieses Landes ist erstaunlich! Kisten voll Gold, Geschmeide und mannigfaltigen Gemmen strömen in die Hafenstädte. Nun, derartiges zu sehen befördert nicht immer das Beste in den Menschen. Um ehrlich zu sein, Gouverneur, man munkelt in den Spelunken und Hafenvierteln bereits, welches Lagerhaus einen Besuch gar lohnen würde. Wenn Ihr nicht bald etwas unternehmt, dann wird die Gier Eure braven Kolonisten vergiften.
TEXT.Italian: The amount of gold and other treasure, that is carried through our cities, is getting attention, a lot of attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.
TEXT.Spanish: The amount of gold and other treasure, that is carried through our cities, is getting attention, a lot of attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.

TEXT.English: They will not! Such talk is rubbish!
TEXT.French: Îíè íå ïîääàäóòñÿ! Ýòè ðàçãîâîðû - ÷óøü!
TEXT.German: Leeres Geschwätz. Diese treuen Seelen würden sich nie an meinem, also, ähäm, ich meine natürlich seiner Majestät Eigentum vergreifen. Hinfort! Beleidigt mein Ohr nicht mit solchen Lügenmärchen.
TEXT.Italian: They will not! Such Talking is rubbish!
TEXT.Spanish: They will not! Such Talking is rubbish!

TEXT.English: Take some gold to pay more guards and be prepared!
TEXT.French: Âîçüìèòå íåìíîãî çîëîòà, ÷òîá îïëàòèòü îõðàííèêîâ, è áóäüòå íàãîòîâå!
TEXT.German: Nun, das ist leider nur allzu wahr gesprochen. Nehmt etwas Gold und verstärkt die Wachmannschaften. Lasst uns hoffen, dass wir diese Quellen der Gier so rasch als möglich verschiffen können.
TEXT.Italian: Take some gold to pay more guards and be prepared!
TEXT.Spanish: Take some gold to pay more guards and be prepared!

TEXT.English: Get every adventurer on a horse and run them out of town. Let them find their own gold somewhere far, far away ...
TEXT.French: Ñõâàòèòü âñåõ âåðõîâûõ ïóòåøåñòâåííèêîâ è âûãíàòü èõ èç ãîðîäà. Ïóñòü èùóò çîëîòî äëÿ ñåáÿ ãäå-òî ïîäàëüøå, íàìíîãî äàëüøå ýòèõ çåìåëü ...
TEXT.German: Trommelt die Leute zusammen! Lasst auf jedem Markte verkünden, dass der Reichtum des Landes unermesslich sei und jeder, der mit Lust und Wille in seine Tiefen vorstöße, das Gold mit bloßen Händen aufklauben könne! Vor allem fern unserer Häuser und Kirchen liegt das irdische Glück, weit, weit hinter den Hügeln. Gebt darauf jedem Halsabschneider, dem die Gier zu Kopfe gestiegen ist, ein Pferd und lasst ihn nicht aus den Augen, bis er hinter den Hügeln ist. Dann sollte wieder Ruhe einkehren.
TEXT.Italian: So get every venturer on a horse and right out of town. They may found their own gold somewhere far, far away ...
TEXT.Spanish: So get every venturer on a horse and right out of town. They may found their own gold somewhere far, far away ...

TEXT.English: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirates. Of course, weve never talked about this, right?
TEXT.French: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirates. Of course, weve never talked about this, right?
TEXT.German: Ei, da hat sich unter meine braven Kolonisten doch nicht der Abschaum der Gosse gemischt? Wohlan, lasst die Türen unverschlossen, streut weiter in den Kneipen, wo es etwas zu holen gibt. Ja, und wenn das Pack seine Beute versaufet und verspielet, dann legt sie in Ketten und bringt sie heimlich auf den alten Kahn im Hafen. Dort dürfen sie dann wählen, ob sie ihre Schuld Prise für Prise abzahlen oder mit Peitsche und Pranger abbluten wollen.
TEXT.Italian: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirats, and of course, weve never talked about this, right?
TEXT.Spanish: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirats, and of course, weve never talked about this, right?

TEXT.English: An old ship sets sail ...
TEXT.French: À âîò è ñòàðîå ñóäåíûøêî ïëûâåò ...
TEXT.German: Ein alter Kahn sticht im Schatten der Unruhe unter Kapitän Jakob Spatz in See ...
TEXT.Italian: An old ship sets sail ...
TEXT.Spanish: An old ship sets sail ...

TEXT.English: A change in the currents has disrupted usual spawning patterns, and fishermen trawling from the ports of %s2_city are hauling in an unusually rich catch. Although seasonal yields are booming, local elders grumble that such intense harvesting may jeopardize the catch in years to come.
TEXT.French: Èçìåíèâøååñÿ òå÷åíèå íàðóøèëî ïðèâû÷íûé íåðåñò è ðûáàêè òðàëîâîãî ïðîìûñëà áëèç ïîðòîâ %s2_city ïðèâåçëè íåîáû÷àéíî áîãàòûé óëîâ. È õîòÿ ñåçîííàÿ äîáû÷à ïðåâçîøëà âñå îæèäàíèÿ, ñòàðèêè âîð÷àò, ÿêîáû èíòåíñèâíûé âûëîâ ñåé÷àñ, ìîæåò ïëîõî ñêàçàòüñÿ â áóäóùåì.
TEXT.German: Eine Strömungsänderung hat das übliche Laichverhalten gestört und die Fischerleute aus %s2_city ziehen ungewöhnlich reiche Fänge auf ihre Boote. Obwohl die saisonalen Erträge in die Höhe schiessen, raten örtliche erfahrene Fischer zur Zruückhaltung, um durch die das intensive Fischen nicht die Erträge der kommenden Jahre zu gefährden.
TEXT.Italian: A change in the currents has disrupted usual spawning patterns, and fishermen trawling from the ports of %s2_city are hauling in an unusually rich catch. Although seasonal yields are booming, local elders grumble that such intense harvesting may jeopardize the catch in years to come.
TEXT.Spanish: A change in the currents has disrupted usual spawning patterns, and fishermen trawling from the ports of %s2_city are hauling in an unusually rich catch. Although seasonal yields are booming, local elders grumble that such intense harvesting may jeopardize the catch in years to come.

TEXT.English: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread wide the nets!
TEXT.French: Ê ÷åìó øóìåòü ãëóïöû! Øèðå ðàñêèäûâàéòå ñåòè!
TEXT.German: Was für ein Schwachsinn! Werft die Netze weit aus!
TEXT.Italian: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread wide the nets!
TEXT.Spanish: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread wide the nets!

TEXT.English: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.
TEXT.French: Âîèñòèíó, ìû îáÿçàíû ìóäðî ðàñïðåäåëÿòü äàðû ïðèðîäû. Äàâàéòå óñòàíîâèì æåñòêèå îãðàíè÷åíèÿ íà îñòàòîê ñåçîíà.
TEXT.German: Wahrhaftig, wir sollten auf die weisen Männer hören. Lasst uns strenge Fangquoten für die restliche Saison festlegen.
TEXT.Italian: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.
TEXT.Spanish: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.

TEXT.English: Attracted by wild rumors of rich local silver deposits, independent foreign prospectors have been pouring into the mountains near %s2_city. Before long, these itinerant claimjumpers may have taken the best pickings for themselves!
TEXT.French: Õîäÿò íåâåðîÿòíûå ñëóõè î áîãàòûõ ìåñòîðîæäåíèÿõ ñåðåáðà,êàê ñëåäñòâèå - íåçàâèñèìûå èíîñòðàííûå èñêàòåëè óæå ðûùóò â ãîðàõ áëèç %s2_city. ×òî æ ïóñêàé èùóò, à âñÿ äîáû÷à äîñòàíåòñÿ íàì!
TEXT.German: Durch wilde Gerüchte bezüglich reicher Silbervorkommen angelockt, strömen fremde Glücksuchende in die Berge nahe %s2_city. Bald werden diese die besten Claims für sich beansprucht haben!
TEXT.Italian: Attracted by wild rumors of rich local silver deposits, independent foreign prospectors have been pouring into the mountains near %s2_city. Before long, these itinerant claimjumpers may have taken the best pickings for themselves!
TEXT.Spanish: Attracted by wild rumors of rich local silver deposits, independent foreign prospectors have been pouring into the mountains near %s2_city. Before long, these itinerant claimjumpers may have taken the best pickings for themselves!

TEXT.English: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.
TEXT.French: Ïðîäàäèì ðàçðåøåíèå íà ðàçðàáîòêó æèë îïûòíûì øàõòåðàì, â îáìåí íà áîëüøóþ äîëþ ïðèáûëè ïåðâîãî ãîäà.
TEXT.German: Verkauft Claimrechte an die wohlhabenderen unter ihnen und verlangt dafür einen Anteil am Profit des ersten Jahres.
TEXT.Italian: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.

TEXT.English: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.
TEXT.French: Ïðîäàäèì ðàçðåøåíèå íà ðàçðàáîòêó æèë îïûòíûì øàõòåðàì, òðåáóÿ äåíüãè âïåðåä.
TEXT.German: Verkauft Claimrechte an die wohlhabenderen unter ihnen und verlangt dafür eine sofortige Vorausbezahlung.
TEXT.Italian: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.

TEXT.English: Pay to outfit them with the finest equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.
TEXT.French: Îïëà÷èâàéòå òðóä èíîñòðàíöåâ è ñíàáæàéòå èõ ëó÷øèì îáîðóäîâàíèåì òàê äîëãî ñêîëüêî ïîòðåáóåòñÿ, óâåðåí îíè ñîãëàñÿòñÿ ñòàòü íàøèìè ïîääàíûìè.
TEXT.German: Stattet sie mit bester Ausrüstung aus, wenn sie sich bereit erklären unsere loyalen Untertanen zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Pay to outfit them with the finest equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.
TEXT.Spanish: Pay to outfit them with the finest equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.

TEXT.English: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!
TEXT.French: Âûãíàòü èõ èç ãîðîäà! Ýòî ñåðåáðî ïðèíàäëåæèò òîëüêî ìíå!
TEXT.German: Vertreibt sie aus der Stadt! Dieses Silber gehört uns alleine!
TEXT.Italian: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!
TEXT.Spanish: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!

TEXT.English: The townsfolk are whispering that a large family of recent immigrants to %s2_city are suspected to be witches! They keep to themselves, grow strange roots in cottage gardens, and don't attend church on Sundays. One of them even has a birthmark!
TEXT.French: Íàðîä øåï÷åòñÿ, ÷òî ìíîãîäåòíàÿ ñåìüÿ íåäàâíî ïðèáûâøèõ â %s2_city ìèãðàíòîâ çàíèìàåòñÿ êîëäîâñòâîì! ßêîáû îíè ìîë÷àëèâûå,âûðàùèâàþò ñòðàííûå êîðíè ó ñåáÿ â ñàäó, è íå õîäÿò â öåðêîâü ïî âîñêðåñåíüÿì. À íà îäíîì èç íèõ äàæå åñòü ðîäèìîå ïÿòíî!
TEXT.German: Die Bevölkerung flüstert, dass eine grosse Familie, die kürzlich in %s2_city eingewandert ist, unter dem Verdacht der Hexerei steht. Sie bleiben unter sich, bauen seltsame Wurzeln und Kräuter an und nehmen nicht an Gottesdiensten teil. Einer von Ihnen hat sogar ein auffallendes Geburtsmal.
TEXT.Italian: The townsfolk are whispering that a large family of recent immigrants to %s2_city are suspected to be witches! They keep to themselves, grow strange roots in cottage gardens, and don't attend church on Sundays. One of them even has a birthmark!
TEXT.Spanish: The townsfolk are whispering that a large family of recent immigrants to %s2_city are suspected to be witches! They keep to themselves, grow strange roots in cottage gardens, and don't attend church on Sundays. One of them even has a birthmark!

TEXT.English: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.
TEXT.French: Ýòî ñóåâåðíûé áðåä. Íàøå îáùåñòâî âñåãäà ðàäî íîâîïðèáûâøèì, ñ ðîäèìûìè ïÿòíàìè èëè áåç.
TEXT.German: Das ist abergläubischer Unsinn. Sie sind selbstverständlich in unserer Gemeinschaft willkommen.
TEXT.Italian: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.
TEXT.Spanish: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.

TEXT.English: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.
TEXT.French: Ýòî òÿæåëîå îáâèíåíèå è äîëæíî ðàññìîòðåòüñÿ âñåðüåç! Çàäåðæàòü èõ è îòïðàâèòü íà èññëåäîâàíèå ýêñïåðòàì èç Åâðîïû, ïóñòü ðàçáåðóòñÿ â ýòîì ïî ñóùåñòâó.
TEXT.German: Eine schwere Anschuldigung, die aber ernst genommen werden muss. Nehmt sie vorläufig fest und schickt nach einem Experten aus Europa um den Sachverhalt zu klären.
TEXT.Italian: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.
TEXT.Spanish: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.

TEXT.English: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.
TEXT.French: Áðîñèòü èõ â ðåêó. Åñëè âûïëûâóò - îíè íàâåðíÿêà ñëóãè äüÿâîëà. Åñëè íåò, ÷òî æ, ïî êðàéíåé ìåðå ìû äîêàæåì íàøå áëàãî÷åñòèå.
TEXT.German: Werft sie alle gefesselt in den Fluss. Falls sie nicht unter gehen, sind sie mit dem Teufel im Bunde. Falls doch, habe wir wenigstens unsere Gottesfürchtigkeit bewiesen.
TEXT.Italian: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.
TEXT.Spanish: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.

TEXT.English: Our beloved monarch has suddenly developed an eccentric opinion that tobacco smoking is injurious to the lungs, even going so far as to publish a pamphlet denouncing the habit. This bizarre idea could ruin our export market!
TEXT.French: Íàø âîçëþáëåííûé ìîíàðõ ïðèøåë ê ìûñëè ÷òî êóðåíèå âðåäíî äëÿ ëåãêèõ, è çàøåë â ýòîì òàê äàëåêî, ÷òî äàæå îïóáëèêîâàë îñóæäàþùóþ áðîøþðó. Ýòî ñòðàííàÿ èäåÿ ìîæåò ïîñòàâèòü êðåñò íà íàøåì ýêñïîðòå!
TEXT.German: Unser geliebter Herrscher hat kürzlich eine exzentrische Meinung zum Tabakgenuss entwickelt. Er glaubt, dies sei schadhaft für die Lungen. Er will sogar so weit gehen ein Pamphlet zu veröffentlichen, dass davor warnt. Dies bizarre Idee kann unsere Exporteinnahmen schwer schädigen.
TEXT.Italian: Our beloved monarch has suddenly developed an eccentric opinion that tobacco smoking is injurious to the lungs, even going so far as to publish a pamphlet denouncing the habit. This bizarre idea could ruin our export market!
TEXT.Spanish: Our beloved monarch has suddenly developed an eccentric opinion that tobacco smoking is injurious to the lungs, even going so far as to publish a pamphlet denouncing the habit. This bizarre idea could ruin our export market!

TEXT.English: As strange and misguided as this may be, we have little choice but to accept it.
TEXT.French: Êàê áû ñòðàííî è íåïðàâèëüíî ýòî íå áûëî, ìû ìîæåì òîëüêî ïðèíÿòü åãî ðåøåíèå.
TEXT.German: So selstam und fehlgeleitet dieser Gedanke auch ist, so müssen wir die Meinung unserer Herrschers akzeptieren.
TEXT.Italian: As strange and misguided as this may be, we have little choice but to accept it.
TEXT.Spanish: As strange and misguided as this may be, we have little choice but to accept it.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Nobles and citizens are following the example of their king. Demand for our colonial goods is declining.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Äâîðÿíå è ãðàæäàíå ñëåäóþò ïðèìåðó ñâîåãî êîðîëÿ. Ñïðîñ íà íàøè êîëîíèàëüíûå òîâàðû ïàäàåò.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Eure Antwort wurde dem König zugetragen. Kammerdiener berichten, er habe gleich eine Probe verköstigt und anschließend huldvoll genickt.[NEWLINE]Adlige und reiche Bürger in unserer Heimat eifern nun dem König nach. Die Nachfrage nach unseren Kolonialwaren sinkt.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Nobles and citizens are following the example of their king. Demand for our colonial goods is declining.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Nobles and citizens are following the example of their king. Demand for our colonial goods is declining.[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: His Highness has clearly taken leave of his senses! We must fund opposing pamphleteers to shut down this preposterous calumny!
TEXT.French: Åãî Âûñî÷åñòâî ÿâíî ñîøåë ñ óìà! Ïðîôèíàíàñèðóéòå ïàìôëåòèñòîâ ïðîòèâîïîëîæíîãî òîëêà è îïðîâåðãíèòå ýòîò íåëåïûé íàâåò!
TEXT.German: Unsere Hoheit hat anscheinend seinen klaren Verstand verloren! Wir müssen sofort ein gegenteiliges Pamphlet finanzieren.
TEXT.Italian: His Highness has clearly taken leave of his senses! We must fund opposing pamphleteers to shut down this preposterous calumny!
TEXT.Spanish: His Highness has clearly taken leave of his senses! We must fund opposing pamphleteers to shut down this preposterous calumny!

TEXT.English: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The king receives word that his citizens in the colonies are questioning his judgment in this matter.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Êîðîëü ïîëó÷èë âåñòü, ÷òî åãî ãðàæäàíå â êîëîíèÿõ ïîäâåðãàþò ñîìíåíèþ âûñî÷àéøåå ñóæäåíèå.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Der König ist höchst unerfreut dass man sein Urteil zu dieser Angelegenheit in Frage stellt.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The king receives word that his citizens in the colonies are questioning his judgment.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The king receives word that his citizens in the colonies are questioning his judgment.[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The price increases since - due to the new offer - the citizens become aware that train oil burns better than tallow[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The price increases since - due to the new offer - the citizens become aware that train oil burns better than tallow[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]Die Nachfrage nach edlem Tranöl in Europa steigt, da die braven Bürger sich aufgrund des neuen Angebots darüber bewusst werden, dass öl besser brennt als Talg.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The price increases since - due to the new offer - the citizens become aware that train oil burns better than tallow[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_FONT_GOLD]The price increases since - due to the new offer - the citizens become aware that train oil burns better than tallow[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Your Lordship, the Royal Navy has requisitioned one of our finest ships to aid in a campaign against the Barbary Pirates. How shall we respond?
TEXT.French: Âàøà Ñâåòëîñòü, Êîðîëåâñêèé ôëîò ïîòðåáîâàë îäèí èç íàøèõ ïðåêðàñíûõ êîðàáëåé, ÷òîáû èñïîëüçîâàòü åãî â êàìïàíèè ïðîòèâ áåðáåðñêèõ ïèðàòîâ. Êàê ìû äîëæíû îòðåàãèðîâàòü?
TEXT.German: Exzellenz, die Royal Navy hat eines unserer besten Schiffe requiriert um in einer Kampagne gegen Piraten zu unterstützen. Wie sollen wir darauf reagieren?
TEXT.Italian: Your Lordship, the Royal Navy has requisitioned one of our finest ships to aid in a campaign against the Barbary Pirates. How shall we respond?
TEXT.Spanish: Your Lordship, the Royal Navy has requisitioned one of our finest ships to aid in a campaign against the Barbary Pirates. How shall we respond?

TEXT.English: We are duty bound to answer. The ship is theirs.
TEXT.French: Ýòî íàø äîëã. Ñóäíî òåïåðü ïðèíàäëåæèò èì.
TEXT.German: Unsere Pflicht gebiete uns zu unterstützen. Sie sollen das Schiff haben.
TEXT.Italian: We are duty bound to answer. The ship is theirs.
TEXT.Spanish: We are duty bound to answer. The ship is theirs.

TEXT.English: Let them build their own ships! We cannot foresake the defense of our shores.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü ñòðîÿò ñâîè êîðàáëè! Ìû íå ìîæåì ïðåíåáðå÷ü îáîðîíîé ñîáñòâåííûõ áåðåãîâ.
TEXT.German: Sie sollen gefälligst ihre eigenen Schiffe nutze. Unsere Küsten dürfen nicht ungeschützt bleiben.
TEXT.Italian: Let them build their own ships! We cannot foresake the defense of our shores.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them build their own ships! We cannot foresake the defense of our shores.

TEXT.English: The Royal Navy has returned our Frigate, somewhat the worse for wear, though with a generous share of booty in her hold!
TEXT.French: Êîðîëåâñêèé ôëîò âåðíóë íàø êîðàáëü, íåñêîëüêî ïîòðåïàííûé îäíàêî ñ áîëüøîé äîëåé äîáû÷è!
TEXT.German: Die Royal Navy hat unser Schiff zürückgegeben. Es ist zwar etwas mitgenommen, aber als Ausgleich erhalten wir einen grosszügigen Anteil an der Beute in Frachtraum.
TEXT.Italian: The Royal Navy has returned our Frigate, somewhat the worse for wear, though with a generous share of booty in her hold!
TEXT.Spanish: The Royal Navy has returned our Frigate, somewhat the worse for wear, though with a generous share of booty in her hold!

TEXT.English: The Royal Court has been taken with the picturesque garb and customs of certain of our converted native subjects, and has sent for them to be transported to Europe.
TEXT.French: Êîðîëåâñêèé äâîð ðàñïîðÿäèëñÿ ñîáðàòü ìåñòíûõ â æèâîïèñíûõ îäåÿíèÿõ, ñ èçîáðàæåííûìè íà íèõ òðàäèöèÿìè è îáû÷àÿìè àáîðèãåíîâ, è îòïðàâèòü â Åâðîïó.
TEXT.German: Der königliche Hof ist fasziniert von der Kunst und Geschichten der Ureinwohner. Man wünscht, dass wir einen Konvertierten Ureinwohner nach Europa schicken.
TEXT.Italian: The Royal Court has been taken with the picturesque garb and customs of certain of our native converts, and has sent for them to be transported to Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: The Royal Court has been taken with the picturesque garb and customs of certain of our native converts, and has sent for them to be transported to Europe.

TEXT.English: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.
TEXT.French: Êàê èì óãîäíî.. âîçìîæíî ýòî óëó÷øèò íàøè îòíîøåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem Wunsch folgen. Vielleicht bringt uns das ja auch einen Gefallen bei Hofe ein.
TEXT.Italian: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.
TEXT.Spanish: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.

TEXT.English: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!
TEXT.French: Ýòî æå ëþäè, à íå ìóçåéíûå ýêñïîíàòû!
TEXT.German: Wir sprechen hier von Menschen und nicht von Ausstellungsstücken!
TEXT.Italian: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!
TEXT.Spanish: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!

TEXT.English: The Royal Navy has requisitioned 200 tons of Lumber for the construction of new ships. The goods are to be collected as soon as possible at the docks of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Êîðîëåâñêèé ôëîò ïîòðåáîâàë 200 òîíí ïèëîìàòåðèàëîâ äëÿ ñòðîèòåëüñòâà íîâûõ êîðàáëåé. Òîâàð äîëæåí áûòü äîñòàâëåí êàê ìîæíî ñêîðåå â äîêè %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die Royal Navy hat 200 Tonnen Holz für den Bau neuer Schiffe angefordert. Das Holz soll so bald wie möglich ine einer Siedlung mit Dock oder Zollhaus bereitgestellt werden.
TEXT.Italian: The Royal Navy has requisitioned 200 tons of lumber for the construction of new ships. The goods are to be collected as soon as possible at any settlement with a Dock or Customs House.
TEXT.Spanish: The Royal Navy has requisitioned 200 tons of lumber for the construction of new ships. The goods are to be collected as soon as possible at any settlement with a Dock or Customs House.

TEXT.English: Fulfill these requirements for the following results:
TEXT.French: Îòðåàãèðîâàòü íà ýòî òðåáîâàíèå ñëåäóþùèì îáðàçîì:
TEXT.German: Leider ist es unserer bescheidenen Wirtschaft nicht möglich dieser Anfrage gerecht zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.
TEXT.Spanish: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.

TEXT.English: Consider it done sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.
TEXT.French: Ñ÷èòàéòå ÷òî ñäåëàíî ñèð! Íàøè îòâàæíûå äðîâîñåêè óæå ïðèñòóïèëè ê ðàáîòå.
TEXT.German: Betrachtet es als erledigt! Unsere Holzfäller werden sich sofort an die Arbeit machen.
TEXT.Italian: Consider it done sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.
TEXT.Spanish: Consider it done sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.

TEXT.English: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.
TEXT.French: Óâû, ÿ ñ ñîæàëåíèåì äîëæåí ñîîáùèòü, ÷òî íàøà ñêðîìíàÿ îòðàñëü íå ñïîñîáíà óäîâëåòâîðèòü âàø çàïðîñ.
TEXT.German: Leider ist es unserer bescheidenen Wirtschaft nicht möglich dieser Anfrage gerecht zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.
TEXT.Spanish: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.

TEXT.English: Representatives of the Royal Navy have arrived at %s2_city to take delivery of 200 tons of lumber, as promised per our previous arrangement.
TEXT.French: Ïðåäñòàâèòåëè Êîðîëåâñêîãî Âîåííî-Ìîðñêîãî Ôëîòà ïðèáûëè â %s2_city ïðèíÿòü ïîñòàâêó 200 òîíí ïèëîìàòåðèàëîâ, êàê áûëî óñëîâëåíî ðàíåå.
TEXT.German: Representanten der Royal Navy sind in %s2_city angekommen um die versprochene Lieferung der 200 Tonnen Holz entgegen zu nehmen.
TEXT.Italian: Representatives of the Royal Navy have arrived at %s2_city to take delivery of 200 tons of lumber, as promised per our previous arrangement.
TEXT.Spanish: Representatives of the Royal Navy have arrived at %s2_city to take delivery of 200 tons of lumber, as promised per our previous arrangement.

TEXT.English: Instantly and without delay! May these fine planks serve His Majesty's fleet well.
TEXT.French: Ìãíîâåííî è áåç çàäåðæåê! Íàäååìñÿ ýòè äîñêè õîðîøî ïîñëóæàò ôëîòó Åãî Âåëè÷åñòâà.
TEXT.German: Selbstverständlich! Mögen diese feinen Planken der Flotte seiner Majestät gut dienen.
TEXT.Italian: Instantly and without delay! May these fine planks serve His Majesty's fleet well.
TEXT.Spanish: Instantly and without delay! May these fine planks serve His Majesty's fleet well.

TEXT.English: I regret to say we now have other uses for these goods. The deal is off.
TEXT.French: Ñ ñîæàëåíèåì äîëæåí ñîîáùèòü, ÷òî ó íàñ íàøëîñü äðóãîå ïðèìåíåíèå ýòèì òîâàðàì. Ñäåëêà îòìåíÿåòñÿ.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern zutiefst, aber wir brauchen diese Waren dringend selbst.
TEXT.Italian: I regret to say we now have other uses for these goods. The deal is off.
TEXT.Spanish: I regret to say we now have other uses for these goods. The deal is off.

TEXT.English: His Royal Highness has decided to finance a polar expedition in search of the fabled Terra Australis. 200 crates of fine winter Coats have been commissioned from the furriers of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Åãî Êîðîëåâñêîå Âåëè÷åñòâî ðåøèë ïðîôèíàíñèðîâàòü ïîëÿðíóþ ýêñïåäèöèþ â ïîèñêàõ ëåãåíäàðíîé Òåððà Àóñòðàëèóñ. 200 ÿùèêîâ ÷óäåñíûõ, çèìíèõ ïàëüòî áûëè èçüÿòû ó ñêîðíÿêîâ èç %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Seine königliche Hoheit hat beschlossen eine Polar-Expedition auszustatten um das sagenhafte Terra Australis zu finden. 200 Ladungen der besten Mäntel werden von den Pelzhändlern von %s2_city verlangt.
TEXT.Italian: His Royal Highness has decided to finance a polar expedition in search of the fabled Terra Australis. 200 crates of fine winter Coats have been commissioned from the furriers of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: His Royal Highness has decided to finance a polar expedition in search of the fabled Terra Australis. 200 crates of fine winter Coats have been commissioned from the furriers of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!
TEXT.French: Âàøå æåëàíèå - íàø çàêîí ñèð. Ïóñòü êàæäûé àéñáåðã áóäåò íàçâàí â âàøó ÷åñòü!
TEXT.German: Euer Wunsch ist unser Befehl. Möge jeder Eisberg im Namen seiner Majestät bezwungen werden!
TEXT.Italian: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!
TEXT.Spanish: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!

TEXT.English: His Majesty's explorers have arrived to collect the shipment of Coats for their polar expedition.
TEXT.French: Èññëåäîâàòåëè Åãî Âåëè÷åñòâà ïðèáûëè, ÷òîáû çàáðàòü ïàðòèþ ïàëüòî äëÿ ñâîåé ïîëÿðíîé ýêñïåäèöèè.
TEXT.German: Die Entdecker seiner Majestät sind angekommen um die Ladung Mäntel für die Polar-Expedition abzuholen.
TEXT.Italian: His Majesty's explorers have arrived to collect the shipment of Coats for their polar expedition.
TEXT.Spanish: His Majesty's explorers have arrived to collect the shipment of Coats for their polar expedition.

TEXT.English: Take them with our best wishes for a safe journey. The fabled riches of Terra Australis shall be ours!
TEXT.French: Âîçüìèòå èõ ñ íàøèìè íàèëó÷øèìè ïîæåëàíèÿìè äëÿ áîëåå áåçîïàñíîãî ïóòåøåñòâèÿ. Ëåãåíäàðíîå áîãàòñòâî Òåððà Àóñòðàëèñ áóäåò íàøå!
TEXT.German: Unsere besten Wünsche für ihre Reise. Die sagenhaften Reichtümer der Terra Australis sollen unserer stolzen Nation gehören!
TEXT.Italian: Take them with our best wishes for a safe journey. The fabled riches of Terra Australis shall be ours!
TEXT.Spanish: Take them with our best wishes for a safe journey. The fabled riches of Terra Australis shall be ours!

TEXT.English: It has been quite some time, and the agreed-upon goods have yet to be delivered to %s2_city. His Majesty is not accustomed to being kept waiting!
TEXT.French: Ïðîøëî äîñòàòî÷íî âðåìåíè, íî ñîãëàñîâàííûå òîâàðû åùå íå äîñòàâëåíû â %s2_city. Åãî Âåëè÷åñòâî íå ïðèâûê æäàòü!
TEXT.German: Die Verzögerung der versprochenen Warenlieferung in %s2_city ist sehr bedenklich. Ihre Majestät ist nicht erfreut!
TEXT.Italian: It has been quite some time, and the agreed-upon goods have yet to be delivered to %s2_city. His Majesty is not accustomed to being kept waiting!
TEXT.Spanish: It has been quite some time, and the agreed-upon goods have yet to be delivered to %s2_city. His Majesty is not accustomed to being kept waiting!

TEXT.English: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?
TEXT.French: Ïðèìèòå íàøè íèæàéøèå èçâèíåíèÿ çà íåïðåäâèäåííûå çàäåðæêè, - âîçìîæíî, ýòîò ìàëåíüêèé âêëàä êîìïåíñèðóåò íåóäîáñòâà?
TEXT.German: Unsere untertänigsten Entschuldigungen an den Hof für diese unvorhergesehene Verzögerung. Möge diese kleine Entschädigung diese Unannehmlichkeit vergessen lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?
TEXT.Spanish: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?

TEXT.English: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like to personally lend a hand to the work effort?
TEXT.French: Îíè áóäóò ãîòîâû, êîãäà áóäóò ãîòîâû. Èëè ìîæåò Åãî Âåëè÷åñòâî æåëàåò ëè÷íî ïîó÷àñòâîâàòü â ïðîèçâîäñòâå?
TEXT.German: Wir geben unser Bestes, doch es geht nicht schneller. Anstatt uns zu belästigen könnten die Abgesandten seiner Majestät ja selbst Hand anlegen.
TEXT.Italian: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like to personally lend a hand to the work effort?
TEXT.Spanish: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like to personally lend a hand to the work effort?
