TEXT.English: By royal decree, all further trading in Coats shall be done through duly authorized agents of the Hudson Bay Company.
TEXT.French: Ïî êîðîëåâñêîìó óêàçó, âñÿ äàëüíåéøàÿ òîðãîâëÿ ïàëüòî, äîëæíà ïðîèñõîäèòü ÷åðåç äîëæíûì îáðàçîì óïîëíîìî÷åííûõ àãåíòîâ êîìïàíèè Ãóäçîíîâà çàëèâà.
TEXT.German: Laut königlichen Beschluss dürfen alle weiteren Handelsgeschäfte mit Pelzen ab sofort nur noch durch Vertreter der Hudson Bay Company erfolgen.
TEXT.Italian: By royal decree, all further trading in Coats shall be done through the agents of the Hudson Bay Company.
TEXT.Spanish: By royal decree, all further trading in Coats shall be done through the agents of the Hudson Bay Company.

TEXT.English: Unnecessary and preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.
TEXT.French: Áåñïîëåçíàÿ íåëåïîñòü! Ìîé óâàæàåìûé ñèð, ìû áîëåå ÷åì ñïîñîáíû ðåãóëèðîâàòü òîðãîâëþ ïóøíèíîé ñàìîñòîÿòåëüíî.
TEXT.German: Absurd! Wir sind mehr als fähig den Pelzhandel im Sinne Ihrer Majestät zu führen.
TEXT.Italian: Preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.
TEXT.Spanish: Preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.

TEXT.English: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.
TEXT.French: Êàê ïîæåëàåòå. Óâåðåí, ÷òî ÷àñòü äèâèäåíäîâ ïåðâîãî ãîäà, áóäóò çàðåçåðâèðîâàíû äëÿ âàøåãî ïîêîðíîãî ñëóãè.
TEXT.German: Wie Ihre Majestät wünscht. Wir nehmen aber an, dass ein gerechter Anteil der Gewinne an uns übertragen wird.
TEXT.Italian: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.
TEXT.Spanish: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.

TEXT.English: A band of dastardly horse rustlers has seized the finest animals in our herd, and threatens to torch the barns if they are pursued.
TEXT.French: Áàíäà êîíîêðàäîâ óãíàëè ëó÷øèõ æèâîòíûõ èç íàøåãî ñòàäà, è óãðîæàþò ïîäæå÷ü àìáàðû, åñëè ìû áóäåì èõ ïðåñëåäîâàòü.
TEXT.German: Eine Bande von niederträchtigen Pferdedieben hat die besten Tiere unserer Herde geraubt und droht sogar damit die Stallungen und Scheunen zu verbrennen, wenn Sie verfolgt werden.
TEXT.Italian: A band of dastardly horse rustlers has seized the finest animals in our herd, and threatens to torch the barns if they are pursued.
TEXT.Spanish: A band of dastardly horse rustlers has seized the finest animals in our herd, and threatens to torch the barns if they are pursued.

TEXT.English: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!
TEXT.French: Ê ÷åðòó èõ óãðîçû! Îòïðàâüòå ïîèñêîâóþ ãðóïïó äëÿ âîçâðàùåíèÿ ëîøàäåé è ïðèâåäåíèÿ õóëèãàíîâ ê îòâåòñòâåííîñòè!
TEXT.German: Wir geben nichts auf solche Drohungen! Entsenden eine Truppe um diese Verbrecher der Gerechtigkeit zuzuführen und die Pferde zurückzubringen!
TEXT.Italian: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!
TEXT.Spanish: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!

TEXT.English: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.
TEXT.French: Ìû ìîãëè áû èñïîëüçîâàòü òàêèõ ïðåäïðèèì÷èâûõ ìîëîäûõ ëþäåé êàê ýòè. Ïðåäëîæèòå èì ëîøàäåé è ïîìèëîâàíèå, åñëè îíè ñîãëàñÿòñÿ ïðèñîåäèíèòüñÿ ê íàì(íåêîòîðûå èç íèõ) íà ïðàâàõ çàêîíîïîñëóøíûõ ãðàæäàí.
TEXT.German: Lasst uns diesen armen Seelen einen anderen Weg aufzeigen. Bietet ihnen an die Pferde zu behalten, wenn Sie deren Wert bei uns abarbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.
TEXT.Spanish: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.

TEXT.English: The winter has been hard, and the guards of %s2_city have caught a band of natives from a nearby %s1_player settlement attempting to steal cattle from our herds for sustenance.
TEXT.French: Çèìà áûëà íåëåãêîé, è ñòðàæíèêè %s2_city ïîéìàëè áàíäó âûõîäöåâ èç ñîñåäíåãî %s1_player ïîñåëåíèÿ ïðè ïîïûòêå óêðàñòü íàø ñêîò äëÿ ïðîïèòàíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Der harte letzte Winter hat die Ureinwohner einer nahen %s1_player Siedlung dazu verleitet Vieh der Herden von %s2_city zu stehlen, doch unsere wachsame Stadtwache hat sie dabei gefangen.
TEXT.Italian: The winter has been hard, and the guards of %s2_city have caught a band of natives from a nearby %s1_player settlement attempting to steal cattle from our herds for sustenance.
TEXT.Spanish: The winter has been hard, and the guards of %s2_city have caught a band of natives from a nearby %s1_player settlement attempting to steal cattle from our herds for sustenance.

TEXT.English: Let them go in peace with enough animals to feed their tribe, provided they let their chief know of our goodwill.
TEXT.French: Äàäèì èì óéòè ñ ìèðîì è äîñòàòî÷íûì êîëè÷åñòâîì æèâîòíûõ ÷òîáû ïðîêîðìèòü ãðóïïó, ïåðåäàéòå èõ ãëàâå íàøó äîáðóþ âîëþ.
TEXT.German: Gebt Ihnen genug Vieh um ihr Dorf zu erhalten und lasst sie in Frieden ziehen. Dies sei ein Zeichen unseres guten Willens.
TEXT.Italian: Let them go in peace with enough animals to feed their tribe, provided they let their chief know of our goodwill.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them go in peace with enough animals to feed their tribe, provided they let their chief know of our goodwill.

TEXT.English: Drive a hard bargain to let them take the cattle in exchange for land and gold.
TEXT.French: Ïîòîðãóåìñÿ, ïóñòü çàáèðàþò ñêîò â îáìåí íà çåìëè è çîëîòî.
TEXT.German: Gebt ihnen das Vieh, doch lasst sie einen hohen Preis if Form von Gold und Land zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Drive a hard bargain to let them take the cattle in exchange for land and gold.
TEXT.Spanish: Drive a hard bargain to let them take the cattle in exchange for land and gold.

TEXT.English: Put them in irons and set them to work the fields! We can spare no charity for these thieving savages.
TEXT.French: Çàêîâàòü è â êàíäàëû è îòïðàâèòü íà ïîëÿ! Ìû íå áóäåì èãðàòü â áëàãîòâîðèòåëüíîñòü ñ ýòèìè âîðîâàòûìè äèêàðÿìè.
TEXT.German: Legt den Dieben Eisen an uns lasst sie für diesen Frevel auf den Feldern Arbeiten!
TEXT.Italian: Put them in irons and set them to work the fields! We can spare no charity for these thieving savages.
TEXT.Spanish: Put them in irons and set them to work the fields! We can spare no charity for these thieving savages.

TEXT.English: Relations with your King have improved.
TEXT.French: Îòíîøåíèÿ ìåæäó âàìè è êîðîëåì óëó÷øèëèñü.
TEXT.German: Ihre Majestät ist über diese Antwort sehr erfreut.
TEXT.Italian: Your King is delighted by this reponse.
TEXT.Spanish: Your King is delighted by this reponse.

TEXT.English: Your King has been angered!
TEXT.German: Ihre Majestät ist über diese Reaktion sehr verärgert.
TEXT.Italian: Your King has been angered!
TEXT.Spanish: Your King has been angered!

TEXT.English: By solemn decree of His Royal Majesty's Privy Council, your treasonous and obstreporous perfidy has gone on long enough! In partial recompense of your numerous misdeeds, a heavy fine must be paid at once into the royal coffers, or royal agents are authorized to sack the countryside of %s2_city and confiscate their rightful wealth!
TEXT.French: Òîðæåñòâåííûì óêàçîì Ëè÷íîãî Ñîâåòà Åãî Êîðîëåâñêîãî Âåëè÷åñòâà âû îáâèíÿåòåñü â èçìåíå è âåðîëîìñòâå, ÷åì ïðîìûøëÿëè äîñòàòî÷íî äîëãî! Äàáû îò÷àñòè êîìïåíñèðîâàòü ñâîè ïðîñòóïêè, âàì ñëåäóåò óïëàòèòü òÿæåëûé øòðàô (íåïîñðåäñòâåííî â êîðîëåâñêóþ êàçíó), èëè æå êîðîëåâñêèå ïðåäñòàâèòåëè áóäóò óïîëíîìî÷åíû çàêîííî êîíôèñêîâàòü âàøè áîãàòñòâà áëèç %s2_city!
TEXT.German: Durch unumstösslichen Beschluss Ihrer Majestät, wird euer verräterisches Handeln bestraft. Als teilweise Wiedergutmachung eurer vielen Vergehen, werdet ihr sofort eine Strafe zahlen oder königliche Abgesandte sind dazu authorisiert im Umland von %s2_city alles zu konfiszieren, was rechtmässig Ihrer Majestät gehört!
TEXT.Italian: By solemn decree of His Royal Majesty's Privy Council, your treasonous and obstreporous perfidy has gone on long enough! In partial recompense of your numerous misdeeds, a heavy fine must be paid at once into the royal coffers, or royal agents are authorized to sack the countryside of %s2_city and confiscate their rightful wealth!
TEXT.Spanish: By solemn decree of His Royal Majesty's Privy Council, your treasonous and obstreporous perfidy has gone on long enough! In partial recompense of your numerous misdeeds, a heavy fine must be paid at once into the royal coffers, or royal agents are authorized to sack the countryside of %s2_city and confiscate their rightful wealth!

TEXT.English: By all means, sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.
TEXT.French: Íåïðåìåííî ñèð; ìû íå õîòèì ãíåâà êîðîíû.
TEXT.German: Um Himmels Willen, wir würden niemals absichtlich Ihre Majestät verärgern!
TEXT.Italian: By all means, sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.
TEXT.Spanish: By all means, sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.

TEXT.English: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.
TEXT.French: Äåëàéòå ñâîå ãðÿçíîå äåëî! Ýòè èíòðèãàíû ìèíèñòðû íèêîãäà íå íàñûòÿòñÿ, îíè áóäóò âûæèìàòü âñå äî ïîñëåäíåé êàïëè èç íàøèõ ÷åñòíûõ ãîðîæàí.
TEXT.German: Wir erwarten euer Schlimmstes! Die gierigen Abgesandten Ihrer Majestät werden eh nie zufrieden sein, bevor sie unsere armen Bürger gänzlich geplündert haben.
TEXT.Italian: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.
TEXT.Spanish: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.

TEXT.English: Through the worship and toil of your people, the Cathedral of %s2_city has been proclaimed the seat of a new Archbishopric, attracting pilgrims from the surrounding churches.
TEXT.French: Ïîêëîíåíèåì è òðóäîì âàøèõ ëþäåé, Ñîáîð â %s2_city áûë ïðîâîçãëàøåí ðåçèäåíöèåé íîâîãî Àðõèåïèñêîïñòâà, ïðèâëåêàÿ ïàëîìíèêîâ èç îêðåñòíûõ öåðêâåé.
TEXT.German: Aufgrund der Verehrung durch die Bevölkerung und ihrer geschichtlichen Bedeutung, wurde die Kathedrale von %s2_city zum Sitze des Erzbischofs ernannt und zieht nun noch mehr Pilger aus der Gegend an.
TEXT.Italian: Through the worship and toil of your people, the Cathedral of %s2_city has been proclaimed the seat of a new Archbishopric, attracting pilgrims from the surrounding churches.
TEXT.Spanish: Through the worship and toil of your people, the Cathedral of %s2_city has been proclaimed the seat of a new Archbishopric, attracting pilgrims from the surrounding churches.

TEXT.English: Glory be to the Almighty!
TEXT.French: Ñëàâà Âñåâûøíåìó!
TEXT.German: Ruhm sei dem Allmächtigen!
TEXT.Italian: Glory be to the Almighty!
TEXT.Spanish: Glory be to the Almighty!

TEXT.English: As your colonies have now made contact with multiple native peoples, a local merchant in %s2city proposes a modest investment in a network of trading posts that can gather rare and valuable spices from distant tribes.
TEXT.French: Òàê êàê âàøè êîëîíèè óæå ñâÿçàëèñü ñ íåñêîëüêèìè êîðåííûìè íàðîäàìè, ìåñòíûå òîðãîâåö â %s2city ïðåäëàãàåò âàì âëîæèòü ñêðîìíûå èíâåñòèöèè â ñåòü òîðãîâûõ ïîñòîâ, áëàãîäàðÿ êîòîðûì ìîæíî áóäåò ïðèîáðåòàòü ðåäêèå è öåííûå ñïåöèè èç äàëåêèõ ïëåìåí.
TEXT.German: Da unsere Kolonien nun Kontakt zu mehreren Ureinwohnerstämmen haben, hat ein örtlicher Händler vorgeschlagen von %s2city ein Netzwerka aus Handelsposten aufzubauen, dass seltene Güter von diesen Stämmen erwirbt.
TEXT.Italian: As your colonies have now made contact with multiple native peoples, a local merchant in %s2city proposes a modest investment in a network of trading posts that can gather rare and valuable spices from distant tribes.
TEXT.Spanish: As your colonies have now made contact with multiple native peoples, a local merchant in %s2city proposes a modest investment in a network of trading posts that can gather rare and valuable spices from distant tribes.

TEXT.English: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on the capital invested.
TEXT.French: Îòëè÷íàÿ èäåÿ! Íî ïîìíèòå ìû æäåì õîðîøóþ îòäà÷ó îò íàøèõ âëîæåíèé.
TEXT.German: Eine hervorragende Idee! Wir erwarten jedoch gute Erträge unserer Investition.
TEXT.Italian: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on the capital invested.
TEXT.Spanish: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on the capital invested.

TEXT.English: Alas, we can scarcely afford such a venture at the moment.
TEXT.French: Óâû, ìû âðÿä ëè ìîæåì ïîçâîëèòü ñåáå òàêîå ïðåäïðèÿòèå â äàííûé ìîìåíò.
TEXT.German: Leider können wir uns solch ein Wagnis im Moment kaum leisten.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, we can scarcely afford such a venture at the moment.
TEXT.Spanish: Alas, we can scarcely afford such a venture at the moment.

TEXT.English: Spying the growing wealth of our sea traders, a scurvy band of pirates has gathered near our shores, demanding a thousand gold doubloons in ransom lest they put our shipping to the torch!
TEXT.French: Ïèðàòû, íàáëþäàþùèå ðîñò áëàãîñîñòîÿíèÿ íàøåé ìîðñêîé òîðãîâëè, óñòðîèëè áëîêàäó ïîáåðåæèé è òðåáóþò íà îòêóï òûñÿ÷ó çîëîòûõ äóáëîíîâ!
TEXT.German: Durch den wachsenden Reichtum unserer Seehändler angelockt, hat sich eine dreckige Bande Piraten vor unseren Küsten versammelt. Sie verlangen Tausend Golddublonen als Lösegeld damit sie unsere Schiffe nicht in Flammen aufgehen lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Spying the growing wealth of our sea traders, a scurvy band of pirates has gathered near our shores, demanding a thousand gold doubloons in ransom lest they put our shipping to the torch!
TEXT.Spanish: Spying the growing wealth of our sea traders, a scurvy band of pirates has gathered near our shores, demanding a thousand gold doubloons in ransom lest they put our shipping to the torch!

TEXT.English: The infamous pirate lord Roc Brasiliano sends an emissary demanding a princely fortune in gold and silver, threatening otherwise to send our vulnerable merchantmen to the bottom of Davy Jones' locker. How shall we respond?
TEXT.French: Èçâåñòíûé ïèðàòñêèé âîæàê Ðîê Áðàçèëèàíî îòïðàâèë ê íàì ïîñëà ñ òðåáîâàíèåì ïîèñòèíå êíÿæåñêîãî ñîñòîÿíèÿ â çîëîòå è ñåðåáðå, â ïðîòèâíîì ñëó÷àå îí îáåùàåò îòïðàâèòü íàøè òîðãîâûå êîðàáëè íà äíî øêàô÷èêà Äýéâè Äæîíñà. Êàê ñëåäóåò ïîñòóïèòü?
TEXT.German: Der berüchtigte Piratenführer Roc Brasiliano sendet uns einen Abgesandten, der eine königliche Summe Gold und Silber fordert. Andernfalls droht er damit unsere verletzlichen Handelsschiffe auf den Grund von Davy Jones Reich zu schicken.
TEXT.Italian: The infamous pirate lord Roc Brasiliano sends an emissary demanding a princely fortune in gold and silver, threatening otherwise to send our vulnerable merchantmen to the bottom of Davy Jones' locker. How shall we respond?
TEXT.Spanish: The infamous pirate lord Roc Brasiliano sends an emissary demanding a princely fortune in gold and silver, threatening otherwise to send our vulnerable merchantmen to the bottom of Davy Jones' locker. How shall we respond?

TEXT.English: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!
TEXT.French: ß ïîëàãàþ ó íàñ íåò âûáîðà. Ïîòåðÿ äåñÿòêà òîðãîâûõ ñóäîâ îáîéäåòñÿ ãîðàçäî äîðîæå ÷åì åãî òðåáîâàíèÿ!
TEXT.German: Wir haben vermutlich keine andere Wahl. Der Verlust eines Dutzend Handelsschiffe würde uns noch viel teurer kommen.
TEXT.Italian: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!
TEXT.Spanish: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!

TEXT.English: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!
TEXT.French: ß íèêîãäà íå ïîä÷èíþñü ýòèì ïîäëåöàì! Ïóñòü ïîïðîáóþò íàøåé ñòàëè è ïóøåê!
TEXT.German: Wir beugen uns nicht vor Banditen! Lasst sie unseren Stahl und unsere Kanonen schmecken!
TEXT.Italian: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!
TEXT.Spanish: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!

TEXT.English: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners! We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.
TEXT.French: Âû ñëûøàëè ÷òî îí äåëàåò ñî ñâîèìè çàêëþ÷åííûìè! Íàì ñòîèò îòäàòü çîëîòî ñðàçó è ñ÷èòàòü ÷òî ëåãêî îòäåëàëèñü.
TEXT.German: Habt ihr die Gerüchte gehört, was er seinen Gefangen antuen soll ? Wir sollten sofort die Summe übergeben und uns glücklich schätzen.
TEXT.Italian: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners! We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.
TEXT.Spanish: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners! We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.

TEXT.English: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!
TEXT.French: ×óìà íà âàñ ñèð! Âû óçíàåòå èç êàêîãî òåñòà ýòà êîëîíèÿ!
TEXT.German: Alle Flüche der See sollen ihn treffen! Wir greifen zu den Waffen!
TEXT.Italian: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!
TEXT.Spanish: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!

TEXT.English: A European vintager has sold his finest wine plants to the colonies.
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèé âèíîäåë ïðîäàë ñâîè ëó÷øèå âèíîãðàäíûå ñàæåíöû êîëîíèÿì.
TEXT.German: Ein Winzer aus Europa hat seine besten Weinpflanzen in die neue Welt verkauft.
TEXT.Italian: A European vintager has sold his finest wine plants to the colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: A European vintager has sold his finest wine plants to the colonies.

TEXT.English: A European vintager offers to sell us his best wine plants. He demands 400[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèé âèíîäåë ïðåäëàãàåò íàì êóïèòü åãî ëó÷øèå âèíîãðàäíûå ñàæåíöû. Îí çàïðîñèë 400[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.German: Ein Winzer aus Europa bietet uns seine besten Rebstöcke zum Kauf. Er verlangt 400[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.Italian: A European vintager offers to sell us his best wine plants. He demands 400[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.Spanish: A European vintager offers to sell us his best wine plants. He demands 400[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.
TEXT.French: Ýòî õîðîøåå ïðåäëîæåíèå. Ìû çàïëàòèì óêàçàííóþ öåíó.
TEXT.German: Das ist ein sehr gutes Angebot. Wir werden den Preis des Winzers zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Â íàñòîÿùåå âðåìÿ ìû íå ìîæåì ñåáå ïîçâîëèòü òàêèå èíâåñòèöèè.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: Local Natives have sold some of their Red Pepper plants to European colonists.
TEXT.French: Ìåñòíûå æèòåëè ïðîäàëè ÷àñòü ñåìÿí êðàñíîãî ïåðöà åâðîïåéñêèì êîëîíèñòàì.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner haben europäischen Kolonisten Setzlingen ihres Roten Pfeffers verkauft.
TEXT.Italian: Local Natives have sold some of their Red Pepper plants to European colonists.
TEXT.Spanish: Local Natives have sold some of their Red Pepper plants to European colonists.

TEXT.English: Local Natives offer us some seeds of their Red Pepper plants for sale. They demand 300[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.French: Ìåñòíûå æèòåëè ïðåëàãàþò íàì êóïèòü ñåìåíà êðàñíîãî ïåðöà. Îíè ïðîñÿò 300[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner aus der Gegend bieten uns Setzlinge ihres Roten Pfeffers zum Kauf. Sie verlangen 300[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.Italian: Local Natives offer us some seeds of their Red Pepper plants for sale. They demand 300[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.Spanish: Local Natives offer us some seeds of their Red Pepper plants for sale. They demand 300[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.
TEXT.French: Ýòî õîðîøåå ïðåäëîæåíèå. Ìû çàïëàòèì óêàçàííóþ öåíó.
TEXT.German: Das ist ein sehr gutes Angebot. Wir werden den Preis der Wilden zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Â íàñòîÿùåå âðåìÿ ìû íå ìîæåì ñåáå ïîçâîëèòü òàêèå èíâåñòèöèè.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: Many Immigrants arrive sick and diseased in the New World due to the long voyage over sea.
TEXT.French: Ìíîãèå èììèãðàíòû ïðèáûâàþò áîëüíûìè è ñëàáûìè èççà äîëãîãî ïëàâàíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Viele Einwanderer kommen durch die lange Schiffsreise krank in der Neuen Welt an.
TEXT.Italian: Many Immigrants arrive sick and diseased in the New World due to the long voyage over sea.
TEXT.Spanish: Many Immigrants arrive sick and diseased in the New World due to the long voyage over sea.

TEXT.English: Some new Immigrants have arrived. But they seem to be diseased and sick from the long voyage on the ships.
TEXT.French: Ïðèáûëî íåñêîëüêî íîâûõ ìèãðàíòîâ. Íî ïîõîæå èì õóæå è õóæå îò äîëãîãî ïëàâàíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Einige neue Immigranten sind eingetroffen. Sie scheinen durch die lange Schiffreise krank geworden zu sein.
TEXT.Italian: Some new Immigrants have arrived. But they seem to be diseased and sick from the long voyage on the ships.
TEXT.Spanish: Some new Immigrants have arrived. But they seem to be diseased and sick from the long voyage on the ships.

TEXT.English: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.
TEXT.French: Ìû ðàäû ýòèì ñòðàäàëüöàì. Äàéòå èì ÷òî-íèáóäü ïîåñòü, ÷òîáû âîññòàíîâèòü ñèëû.
TEXT.German: Diese armen Seelen sind uns wie alle anderen Willkommen. Gebt ihnen etwas zu Essen, damit sie wieder zu Kräften kommen.
TEXT.Italian: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.
TEXT.Spanish: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.

TEXT.English: Send them away. We cannot risk diseases spreading in our colonies.
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâüòå èõ ïîäàëüøå. Ìû íå ìîæåì ðèñêîâàòü ðàñïðîñòðàíåíèåì áîëåçíåé â íàøèõ êîëîíèÿõ.
TEXT.German: Schickt sie fort. Es muss verhindert werden, dass sich eine Krankheit oder gar eine Seuche in den Kolonien ausbreitet.
TEXT.Italian: Send them away. We cannot risk diseases spreading in our colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Send them away. We cannot risk diseases spreading in our colonies.

TEXT.English: Diseases of the White Man are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.French: Áîëåçíè áåëîãî ÷åëîâåêà ðàñïðîñòðàíÿþòñÿ ïî èíäåéñêèì äåðåâíÿì.
TEXT.German: Die Krankheiten des Weissen Mannes verbreiten sich in den Dörfern der Ureinwohner.
TEXT.Italian: Diseases of the White Man are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.Spanish: Diseases of the White Man are spreading in Native Villages.

TEXT.English: A disease is spreading in a nearby Native village. The Natives believe the disease broke out after some of our citizens visited their village and are now asking for help.
TEXT.French: Áîëåçíü ðàñïðîñòðàíÿåòñÿ â ñîñåäíåé òóçåìíîé äåðåâíå. Èíäåéöû ñ÷èòàþò ÷òî âèíîâàòû íàøè ãðàæäàíå, ïîñåòèâøèå èõ äåðåâíþ, è òåïåðü ïðîñÿò ïîìîùè.
TEXT.German: Eine Krankheit breitet sich in einer nahegelegenen Siedlung der Wilden aus. Sie behaupten, die Krankheit sei ausgebrochen nachdem einige unserer Siedler ihr Dorf besucht hatten. Sie bitten um unsere Hilfe.
TEXT.Italian: A disease is spreading in a nearby Native village. The Natives believe the disease broke out after some of our citizens visited their village and are now asking for help.
TEXT.Spanish: A disease is spreading in a nearby Native village. The Natives believe the disease broke out after some of our citizens visited their village and are now asking for help.

TEXT.English: Send them some food. It is probably just a flu and the Native will be able to recover.
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâüòå èì íåìíîãî åäû. Ýòî íàâåðíÿêà îáû÷íûé ãðèïï è ìåñòíûå áûñòðî âûçäîðîâåþò.
TEXT.German: Schickt ihnen etwas Nahrung. Es ist sicherlich nur eine kleine Erkältung und es geht ihnen bald besser.
TEXT.Italian: Send them some food. It is probably just a flu and the Native will be able to recover.
TEXT.Spanish: Send them some food. It is probably just a flu and the Native will be able to recover.

TEXT.English: They shall bring their diseased to our city. We will pay the doctors for their treatment.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü ïðèâåçóò áîëüíûõ â íàø ãîðîä. Ìû îïëàòèì èõ ëå÷åíèå.
TEXT.German: Die Wilden sollen ihre Kranken in unsere Stadt bringen. Wir werden die Doktoren bezahlen um sie zu behandeln.
TEXT.Italian: They shall bring their diseased to our city. We will pay the doctors for their treatment.
TEXT.Spanish: They shall bring their diseased to our city. We will pay the doctors for their treatment.

TEXT.English: We are deeply sorry, but there is nothing we can do to help.
TEXT.French: Ìû ãëóáîêî ñîæàëååì, íî íè÷åì íå ìîæåì ïîìî÷ü.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern zutiefst, aber es gibt nichts, was wir für sie tun können.
TEXT.Italian: We are deeply sorry, but there is nothing we can do to help.
TEXT.Spanish: We are deeply sorry, but there is nothing we can do to help.

TEXT.English: European Settlers discovered a huge salt deposit near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèå ïîñåëåíöû îáíàðóæèëè îãðîìíûå çàëåæè ñîëè âîçëå %s2_city
TEXT.German: Europäische Siedler haben grosse Salzvorkommen in der Gegend um %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: European Settlers discovered a huge salt deposit near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: European Settlers discovered a huge salt deposit near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Local settlers report that on nearby hills in the desert, the air tastes very salty. A mining expedition might find salt deposits but will cost 500[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.French: Ìåñòíûå æèòåëè ñîîáùàþò, ÷òî íà áëèçëåæàùèõ õîëìàõ â ïóñòûíå, âîçäóõ íà âêóñ ñîëåíûé. Ãîðíàÿ ýêñïåäèöèÿ ìîæåò ïîèñêàòü îòëîæåíèÿ ñîëåé, ÷òî îáîéäåòñÿ â 500[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.German: Lokale Siedler berichten, dass die Luft auf nahegelegenen Hügeln in der Wüste nach Salz riecht. Eine Minenexpedition könnte ein Salzvorkommen entdecken, wird aber 500[ICON_GOLD] kosten.
TEXT.Italian: Local settlers report that on nearby hills in the desert, the air tastes very salty. A mining expedition might find salt deposits but will cost 500[ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.Spanish: Local settlers report that on nearby hills in the desert, the air tastes very salty. A mining expedition might find salt deposits but will cost 500[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.
TEXT.French: Îòïðàâèòü ãîðíóþ ýêñïåäèöèþ. Íàäåþñü îíè ÷òî-íèáóäü íàéäóò.
TEXT.German: Schickt die Minenexpedition auf die Suche.
TEXT.Italian: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.
TEXT.Spanish: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Â íàñòîÿùåå âðåìÿ ìû íå ìîæåì ñåáå ïîçâîëèòü òàêèå èíâåñòèöèè.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: Natives are angry because the White Man is hunting their Bisons.
TEXT.French: Àáîðèãåíû ðàçãíåâàíû, ïîñêîëüêó áåëûé ÷åëîâåê íà÷àë îõîòèòüñÿ íà èõ çóáðîâ.
TEXT.German: Die Ureinwohner sind verärgert, weil die Europäer zu viele Bisons jagen.
TEXT.Italian: Natives are angry because the White Man is hunting their Bisons.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives are angry because the White Man is hunting their Bisons.

TEXT.English: Natives from a nearby tribe approach the mayor of one of our towns and demands that we stop hunting the bisons in the area. They claim that by the right of their ancestors those bisons belong to them and say that they need the meat of the bisons for survival.
TEXT.French: Àáîðèãåíû èç ñîñåäíåãî ïëåìåíè ïðèøëè ê ìýðó îäíîãî èç ãîðîäîâ è òðåáóþò ïðåêðàùåíèÿ îõîòû íà áèçîíîâ. Îíè óòâåðæäàþò ÷òî áèçîíû ïðèíàäëåæàò èì, ïî ïðàâó èõ ïðåäêîâ, è íåîáõîäèìû äëÿ âûæèâàíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner eines nahegelegenen Stammes sind an uns herangetreten. Sie fordern, dass wir die Jagd auf die Bisons der Gegend einstellen. Sie behaupten, dass die Bisons durch das Recht ihrer Vorväter ihnen gehören und sie diese zum Ueberleben brauchen.
TEXT.Italian: Natives from a nearby tribe approach the mayor of one of our towns and demands that we stop hunting the bisons in the area. They claim that by the right of their ancestors those bisons belong to them and say that they need the meat of the bisons for survival.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives from a nearby tribe approach the mayor of one of our towns and demands that we stop hunting the bisons in the area. They claim that by the right of their ancestors those bisons belong to them and say that they need the meat of the bisons for survival.

TEXT.English: Although we cannot force our people to stop hunting bisons, we will share our food with our Native friends in exchange.
TEXT.French: Õîòÿ ìû íå ìîæåì çàñòàâèòü íàø íàðîä ïðåêðàòèòü îõîòó íà áèçîíîâ, ìû ïîäåëèìñÿ åäîé ñ íàøèìè òóçåìíûìè äðóçüÿìè.
TEXT.German: Wir können unsere Bürger nicht zwingen die Jagd auf die Bisons einzustellen, aber im Gegenzug werden wir unsere Nahrung mit unseren wilden Freunden teilen.
TEXT.Italian: Although we cannot force our people to stop hunting bisons, we will share our food with our Native friends in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: Although we cannot force our people to stop hunting bisons, we will share our food with our Native friends in exchange.

TEXT.English: If our local friends have problems with acquiring enough food, they shall come to our cities. We will give them work and pay for their income.
TEXT.French: Åñëè íàøèì òóçåìíûì äðóçüÿì íåäîñòàòî÷íî ïèùè ïóñòü ïðèõîäÿò â ãîðîäà. Ìû äàäèì èì õîðîøî îïëà÷èâàåìóþ ðàáîòó.
TEXT.German: Wenn unserer wilden Freunde mit der Nahrungsversorgung Probleme haben, sollen sie doch in unsere Ortschaften kommen. Wir werden ihnen Arbeit geben und für ihr Einkommen aufkommen.
TEXT.Italian: If our local friends have problems with acquiring enough food, they shall come to our cities. We will give them work and pay for their income.
TEXT.Spanish: If our local friends have problems with acquiring enough food, they shall come to our cities. We will give them work and pay for their income.

TEXT.English: We are sorry if our Native friends have problems. But the Bisons are on our land. We will continue hunting them.
TEXT.French: Íàì î÷åíü æàëü, ÷òî ó íàøèõ òóçåìíûõ äðóçåé âîçíèêëè ïðîáëåìû. Íî çóáðû íàõîäÿòñÿ íà íàøåé çåìëå. Ìû ïðîäîëæèì îõîòó íà íèõ.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern, falls unsere wilden Freunde Probleme haben. Aber die Bisons sind auf unserem Land und wir werden sie weiterhin jagen.
TEXT.Italian: We are sorry if our Native friends have problems. But the Bisons are on our land. We will continue hunting them.
TEXT.Spanish: We are sorry if our Native friends have problems. But the Bisons are on our land. We will continue hunting them.

TEXT.English: European colonists in %s2_city have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to the Natives.
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèå êîëîíèñòû â %s2_city ñðóáèëè ãèãàíòñêîå äåðåâî, ñ÷èòàâøååñÿ ñâÿùåííûì ó àáîðèãåíîâ.
TEXT.German: Europäische Kolonisten aus %s2_city haben einen Giant Tree gefällt, der den Ureinwohnern heilig war.
TEXT.Italian: European colonists in %s2_city have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to the Natives.
TEXT.Spanish: European colonists in %s2_city have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to the Natives.

TEXT.English: Natives of a nearby tribe are heavily upset because our lumberjacks have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to them. They demand that the lumberjacks are handed over to them for punishment.
TEXT.French: Àáîðèãåíû èç ñîñåäíåãî ïëåìåíè ñèëüíî ðàññòðîèëèñü, ïîñêîëüêó íàøè äðîâîñåêè ñðóáèëè îãðîìíîå äåðåâî, ñ÷èòàâøååñÿ ìåñòíûìè ñâÿùåííûì. Îíè òðåáóþò âûäàòü äðîâîñåêîâ äëÿ íàêàçàíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner eines nahegelegenen Stammes sind sehr verärgert, weil einige unserer Holzfäller einen Giant Tree gefällt haben, der ihnen heilig war. Sie fordern, dass wir ihnen die Schuldigen zur Bestrafung ausliefern.
TEXT.Italian: Natives of a nearby tribe are heavily upset because our lumberjacks have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to them. They demand that the lumberjacks are handed over to them for punishment.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives of a nearby tribe are heavily upset because our lumberjacks have cut down a giant tree that was sacred to them. They demand that the lumberjacks are handed over to them for punishment.

TEXT.English: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.
TEXT.French: Ìû äåéñòâèòåëüíî ñîæàëååì îá ýòîì íåäîðàçóìåíèè. Íàäåþñü îíè ïðèìóò íàøå çîëîòî è îáåùàíèå ÷òî ïîäîáíîå íå ïîâòîðèòñÿ.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern diesen Vorfall zutiefst. Wir hoffen, dass sie unsere Entschädigung in Gold und unser Versprechen annehmen, dass so etwas nie wieder vorkommen wird.
TEXT.Italian: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.
TEXT.Spanish: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.

TEXT.English: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.
TEXT.French: Ñâÿùåííûå äåðåâüÿ? Íåìåäëåííî îòïðàâüòå ìèññèîíåðîâ, ïóñòü èçãîíÿò ýòè äüÿâîëüñêèå óáåæäåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Heilige Bäume ? Wir müssen nach einem Missionar schicken lassen, der diesen teuflischen Glauben austreibt.
TEXT.Italian: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.
TEXT.Spanish: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.

TEXT.English: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and we can do nothing to revert that.
TEXT.French: Íàì î÷åíü æàëü ÷òî äåðåâî áûëî ñðóáëåíî, íî ìû íå â ñîñòîÿíèè ÷òî-ëèáî èçìåíèòü.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern, aber der Baum wurde bereits gefällt und wir können das leider nicht rückgängig machen.
TEXT.Italian: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and we can do nothing to revert that.
TEXT.Spanish: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and we can do nothing to revert that.

TEXT.English: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Thanksgiving.
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèå êîëîíèñòû â %s2_city îòïðàçäíîâàëè ïåðâûé Äåíü Áëàãîäàðåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Europäische Kolonisten in %s2_city haben das erste Thanksgiving gefeiert.
TEXT.Italian: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Thanksgiving.
TEXT.Spanish: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Thanksgiving.

TEXT.English: The settlers from one of our villages want to celebrate a successful last year and intend to invite their Native neighbours as well. They ask for our permission for that celebration and if we want to sponsor the event.
TEXT.French: Ïîñåëåíöû îäíîé èç íàøèõ äåðåâåíü õîòÿò õîòÿò îòïðàçäíîâàòü óñïåøíîå îêîí÷àíèå ïðîøåäøåãî ãîäà, âìåñòå ñ àáîðèãåíàìè ïî ñîñåäñòâó. Îíè ñïðàøèâàþò íàøåãî ðàçðåøåíèÿ íà ïðîâåäåíèå ïðàçäíèêà è õîòèì ëè ìû ïðîôèíàíñèðîâàòü ìåðîïðèÿòèå.
TEXT.German: Die Siedler einer unserer Städte wollen ein erfolgreiches letztes Jahr feiern und auch ihre Nachbarn aus den nahegelegenene Ureinwohnerdörfern einladen. Sie bitten untertänigst um unsere Erlaubnis für dieses Fest und fragen, ob wir das Ereignis vielleicht sponsoren wollen.
TEXT.Italian: The settlers from one of our villages want to celebrate a successful last year and intend to invite their Native neighbours as well. They ask for our permission for that celebration and if we want to sponsor the event.
TEXT.Spanish: The settlers from one of our villages want to celebrate a successful last year and intend to invite their Native neighbours as well. They ask for our permission for that celebration and if we might sponsor the event.

TEXT.English: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from their storage and will additionally receive some gold from our treasury.
TEXT.French: Ýòî ïðåêðàñíàÿ èäåÿ. Ïåðåäàéòå èì åäó ñî ñêëàäîâ, à òàêæå íåìíîãî çîëîòà èç êàçíû.
TEXT.German: Natürlich werden wir diese hervorragende Idee unterstützen. Sie sollen die Nahrung aus ihren Lagern nehmen und zusätzlich noch etwas Gold aus der Schatzkammer erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from their storage and will additionally receive some gold from our treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from their storage and will additionally receive some gold from our treasury.

TEXT.English: There is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.
TEXT.French: Íåò âðåìåíè íà ðàçâëå÷åíèÿ. Ïóñòü ïðîäîëæàþò ðàáîòàòü.
TEXT.German: Für Feierlichkeiten ist keine Zeit. Richtet ihnen aus, dass sie wieder an ihre Arbeit sollen.
TEXT.Italian: There is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.
TEXT.Spanish: There is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.

TEXT.English: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Halloween in the New World.
TEXT.French: Åâðîïåéñêèå êîëîíèñòû â %s2_city îòïðàçäíîâàëè ïåðâûé Õýëëîóèí â Íîâîì Ñâåòå.
TEXT.German: Europäische Kolonisten in %s2_city haben das erste Halloween in der neuen Welt gefeiert.
TEXT.Italian: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Halloween in the New World.
TEXT.Spanish: European colonists in %s2_city have celebrated the first Halloween in the New World.

TEXT.English: Some settlers that have recently arrived from Ireland and other European countries want to celebrate what they call 'Halloween'. It does sound like a quite wild event, almost heretical.
TEXT.French: Íåêîòîðûå ïîñåëåíöû, ïðèáûâøèå íåäàâíî èç Èðëàíäèè è äðóãèõ åâðîïåéñêèõ ñòðàí, õîòÿò îòïðàçäíîâàòü òî, ÷òî îíè íàçûâàþò ''Õýëëîóèí''. Ýòî çâó÷èò äîñòàòî÷íî äèêî, âîçìîæíî äàæå åðåòè÷åñêè.
TEXT.German: Einige Siedler, die erst kürzlich aus Irland und anderen europäischen Ländern angekommen sind, wollen ein Fest feiern, welches sie 'Halloween' nennen. Das Fest hört sich etwas supekt an.
TEXT.Italian: Some settlers that have recently arrived from Ireland and other European countries want to celebrate what they call 'Halloween'. It does sound like a quite wild event, almost heretical.
TEXT.Spanish: Some settlers that have recently arrived from Ireland and other European countries want to celebrate what they call 'Halloween'. It does sound like a quite wild event, almost heretical.

TEXT.English: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.
TEXT.French: Ìû ïîçâîëèì èì ñîõðàíèòü ñâîè òðàäèöèè. Ýòî òîëüêî ïðèâëå÷åò áîëüøå èììèãðàíòîâ.
TEXT.German: Wir werden sie ihre Tradition aufrecht erhalten lassen. Vielleicht führt dies ja soager zu weiteren Immigranten.
TEXT.Italian: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.

TEXT.English: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.
TEXT.French: Âàøå îïèñàíèå ïðàçäíèêà íå çâó÷èò êàê íå÷òî õðèñòèàíñêîå. Ìû íå ìîæåì ïîçâîëèòü òàêèå åðåòè÷åñêèå âåùè.
TEXT.German: Die Beschreibung dieser Feierlichkeiten klingt nicht sehr christlich. Wir können keine Ketzerei in unseren Kolonien zulassen.
TEXT.Italian: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.
TEXT.Spanish: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.

TEXT.English: Missionary accused of sexually molesting Native women.
TEXT.French: Ìèññèîíåðà îáâèíÿþò â äîìîãàòåëüñòâàõ, â îòíîøåíèè àáîðèãåíîê.
TEXT.German: Ein Missionar wurde beschuldigt Ureinwohnerinnen sexuell zu belästigen.
TEXT.Italian: Missionary accused of sexually molesting Native women.
TEXT.Spanish: Missionary accused of sexually molesting Native women.

TEXT.English: Some Natives from a nearby village have arrived in one of our cities. They have a Missionary with them, who has been tied at his hands, and they accuse him of having sexually molested their women.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî àáîðèãåíîâ èç ñîñåäíåé äåðåâíè ïðèøëè â îäèí èç íàøèõ ãîðîäîâ. Îíè ïðèâåëè ñâÿçàííîãî ìèññèîíåðà è îáâèíÿþò åãî â äîìîãàòåëüñòâàõ, â îòíîøåíèè èõ æåíùèí.
TEXT.German: Einige Wilde aus einer nahegelegenen Siedlung sind in einer unserer Städte angekommen. Sie haben einen gefesselten Missionar bei sich und beschuldigen diesen, dass er ihre Frauen sexuell belästigt habe.
TEXT.Italian: Some Natives from a nearby village have arrived in one of our cities. They have a Missionary with them, who has been tied at his hands, and they accuse him of having sexually molested their women.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Natives from a nearby village have arrived in one of our cities. They have a Missionary with them, who has been tied at his hands, and they accuse him of having sexually molested their women.

TEXT.English: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.
TEXT.French: Ýòî âîçìóòèòåëüíî. Íåìåäëåííî îñâîáîäèòü ìèññèîíåðà. Ñâÿùåííèê íå ìîã ñîòâîðèòü òàêîãî.
TEXT.German: Das ist unerhört. Befreit den Missionar sofort. Ein Mann der Kirche kann sich doch solcher Taten nicht schuldig gemacht haben.
TEXT.Italian: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.
TEXT.Spanish: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.

TEXT.English: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.
TEXT.French: Íàøèì òóçåìíûì äðóçüÿì íè ê ÷åìó ëãàòü. Ìû íàêàæåì ýòîãî ÷åëîâåêà. Îí íèêîãäà íå âåðíåòñÿ íà äîëæíîñòü ìèññèîíåðà èëè ñâÿùåííèêà.
TEXT.German: Nun, unsere wilden Freunde haben keinen Grund zu lügen. Wir werden den Mann bestrafen. Er wird natürlich auch nie wieder ein kirchliches Amt inne haben.
TEXT.Italian: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.

TEXT.English: A deserted wolf whelp has been found in the wilderness.
TEXT.French: Äåòåíûø ïóñòûííîãî âîëêà áûë íàéäåí â ãëóøè.
TEXT.German: Ein verlassener Wolfswelpe wurde in der Wildnis gefunden.
TEXT.Italian: A deserted wolf whelp has been found in the wilderness.
TEXT.Spanish: A deserted wolf whelp has been found in the wilderness.

TEXT.English: Our men have found a deserted wolf whelp in the wilderness. His mother is probably dead. Eventually this young beast can be tamed or it could be sold to some crazy and bored rich man.
TEXT.French: Íàøè ëþäè íàøëè äåòåíûøà ïóñòûííîãî âîëêà â ãëóøè. Åãî ìàòü âåðîÿòíî ìåðòâà. ×òî æ, ìû ìîæåì ïðèðó÷èòü åãî è ïðîäàòü êàêîìó-òî ñóìàñøåäøåìó èëè ñêó÷àþùåìó áîãà÷ó.
TEXT.German: Einer unserer Männer hat einen verlassenen Wolfswelpen in der Wildnis gefunden. Seine Mutter ist wahrscheinlich tot. Vielleicht kann das kleine Biest ja gezähmt werden. Oder wir verkaufen es einem Reichen, der gelangweilt genug ist.
TEXT.Italian: Our men have found a deserted wolf whelp in the wilderness. His mother is probably dead. Eventually this young beast can be tamed or it could be sold to some crazy and bored rich man.
TEXT.Spanish: Our men have found a deserted wolf whelp in the wilderness. His mother is probably dead. Eventually this young beast can be tamed or it could be sold to some crazy and bored rich man.

TEXT.English: Such a proud wolf is a pet worthy of a governor as master.
TEXT.French: Òàêîå ãîðäîå æèâîòíîå êàê ïóñòûííûé âîëê, äîñòîéíî òîëüêî îäíîãî õîçÿèíà - ãóáåðíàòîðà.
TEXT.German: Solch ein stolzes Tier hat einen Gouvernuer als Herren verdient.
TEXT.Italian: Such a proud wolf is a pet worthy of a governor as master.
TEXT.Spanish: Such a proud wolf is a pet worthy of a governor as master.

TEXT.English: What can we do with such a rabid animal? Try to sell it.
TEXT.French: ×òî íàì äåëàòü ñ ýäàêèì äèêèì æèâîòíûì? Ïîïðîáóéòå ïðîäàòü åãî.
TEXT.German: Wir haben für solch ein tollwütiges Tier keine Verwendung. Versucht es zu verkaufen.
TEXT.Italian: What can we do with such a rabid animal? Try to sell it.
TEXT.Spanish: What can we do with such a rabid animal? Try to sell it.

TEXT.English: Some left over construction materials from foundation of a colony were found.
TEXT.French: Êîå-êàêèå ñòðîèòåëüíûå ìàòåðèàëû îñòàëèñü ïîñëå îñíîâàíèÿ êîëîíèè.
TEXT.German: Einige übriggelassene Baumaterialien von der Gründung einer Kolonie wurden entdeckt.
TEXT.Italian: Some left over construction materials from foundation of a colony were found.
TEXT.Spanish: Some left over construction materials from foundation of a colony were found.

TEXT.English: Some colonists of a recently founded city discovered that some materials were left over from its foundation. Some citizens want to use those for constructing a chapel. Other citizens want to build a tavern. Whatever we will decide, one party will be unhappy.
TEXT.French: Íåêîòîðûå êîëîíèñòû îáíàðóæèëè ÷òî íå âñå ñòðîèòåëüíûå ìàòåðèàëû áûëè èñïîëüçîâàíû ïðè çàêëàäêå êîëîíèè. Êîå-êòî õî÷åò èñïîëüçîâàòü èõ äëÿ ñòðîèòåëüñòâà ÷àñîâíè. Èíûå äëÿ òàâåðíû. Òàêèì îáðàçîì êàê áû ìû íå ðåøèëè, - îäíà ñòîðîíà áóäåò íåäîâîëüíà.
TEXT.German: Einige Kolonisten einer kürzlich gegründeten Stadt haben entdeckt, dass noch einige Baumaterialien übrig geblieben sind. Einige Bewohner wollen mit diesen Baumaterialien eine Kapelle errichten. Andere Bewohner wollen stattdessen eine Taverne bauen. Wie auch immer wir uns entscheiden, eine Seite wird unzufrieden sein.
TEXT.Italian: Some colonists of a recently founded city discovered that some materials were left over from its foundation. Some citizens want to use those for constructing a chapel. Other citizens want to build a tavern. Whatever we will decide, one party will be unhappy.
TEXT.Spanish: Some colonists of a recently founded city discovered that some materials were left over from its foundation. Some citizens want to use those for constructing a chapel. Other citizens want to build a tavern. Whatever we will decide, one party will be unhappy.

TEXT.English: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.
TEXT.French: ×àñîâíÿ ÿâëÿåòñÿ åäèíñòâåííî ðàçóìíûì âûáîðîì äëÿ äåòåé Õðèñòà.
TEXT.German: Die Kapelle ist die einzige sinnvolle Wahl für die Kinder Christi.
TEXT.Italian: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.
TEXT.Spanish: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.

TEXT.English: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.
TEXT.French: Òàâåðíà áîëåå âàæíà, òàê êàê ïîìîãàåò ãðàæäàíàì áûòü áëèæå äðóã ê äðóãó.
TEXT.German: Die Taverne ist wichtiger, da sie helfen wird, die Gemeinde näher zusammen zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.
TEXT.Spanish: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.

TEXT.English: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.
TEXT.French: ×òîáû èçáåæàòü êàêèõ-ëèáî ïðîòèâîðå÷èé, êîíôèñêóéòå è ïðîäàéòå îñòàòêè.
TEXT.German: Um Streit zu verhindern, sollen die Materialien einfach verkauft werden.
TEXT.Italian: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.
TEXT.Spanish: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.

TEXT.English: A local farmer has gone bankrupt.
TEXT.French: Ìåñòíûé ôåðìåð îáàíêðîòèëñÿ.
TEXT.German: Ein Farmer aus der Gegend ist bankrott gegangen.
TEXT.Italian: A local farmer has gone bankrupt.
TEXT.Spanish: A local farmer has gone bankrupt.

TEXT.English: A recently immigrated farmer took a high credit to buy some land which he now cannot pay anymore. He wants to sell everything he has to be able to repay the credit and go back to Europe.
TEXT.French: Íåäàâíî èììèãðèðîâàâøèé ôåðìåð âçÿë çíà÷èòåëüíûé êðåäèò íà ïîêóïêó çåìëè, êîòîðûé òåïåðü íå â ñîñòîÿíèè îïëàòèòü. Îí õî÷åò ïðîäàòü âñå ÷òî ìîæåò äëÿ ïîãàøåíèÿ êðåäèòà è âåðíóòüñÿ â Åâðîïó.
TEXT.German: Ein kürzlich eingewanderter Farmer hat einen hohen Kredit aufgenommen um sich etwas Land zu kaufen. Diesen kann er nun nicht mehr zurückzahlen. Daher will er sein gesamtes Habe verkaufen um damit den Kredit zu begleichen und wieder nach Europa heimzukehren.
TEXT.Italian: A recently immigrated farmer took a high credit to buy some land which he now cannot pay anymore. He wants to sell everything he has to be able to repay the credit and go back to Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: A recently immigrated farmer took a high credit to buy some land which he now cannot pay anymore. He wants to sell everything he has to be able to repay the credit and go back to Europe.

TEXT.English: We will pay the poor man's debts if he stays and works for us.
TEXT.French: Ìû îïëàòèì äîëãè áåäíÿãè åñëè îí îñòàíåòñÿ ðàáîòàòü íà íàñ.
TEXT.German: Wir werden die Schulden des armen Mannes begleichen, wenn er für uns arbeitet.
TEXT.Italian: We will pay the poor man's debts if he stays and works for us.
TEXT.Spanish: We will pay the poor man's debts if he stays and works for us.

TEXT.English: We shall help the poor man and buy the remains of his farm.
TEXT.French: Ìû äîëæíû ïîìî÷ü áåäíÿãå è êóïèòü îñòàòêè åãî ôåðìû.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem armen Mann helfen und sein restliches Habe kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: We shall help the poor man and buy the remains of his farm.
TEXT.Spanish: We shall help the poor man and buy the remains of his farm.

TEXT.English: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.French: Ýòî ïå÷àëüíî, íî ÷óæèå äåëà íàñ íå êàñàþòñÿ.
TEXT.German: Das ist zwar traurig, betrifft uns aber nicht.
TEXT.Italian: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.Spanish: This is sad, but it is not our business.

TEXT.English: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended.
TEXT.French: Êðóïíîìàñøòàáíûé âîåííûé êîíôëèêò â Åâðîïå çàêîí÷èëñÿ.
TEXT.German: Ein bedeutender militärischer Konflikt wurde in Europa beendet.
TEXT.Italian: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended.
TEXT.Spanish: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended.

TEXT.English: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended. Many troops are not needed anymore and have been sent home again. Maybe we could hire some of them.
TEXT.French: Êðóïíîìàñøòàáíûé âîåííûé êîíôëèêò â Åâðîïå çàêîí÷èëñÿ. Ìíîãèå ïîäðàçäåëåíèÿ áîëüøå íå íóæíû è áóäóò îòïðàâëåíû ïî äîìàì. Ìîæåò íàì íàíÿòü íåêîòîðûõ èç íèõ.
TEXT.German: Ein bedeutender militärischer Konflikt wurde in Europa beendet. Viele Truppen werden wieder entlassen. Vielleicht können wir einige davon anheuern.
TEXT.Italian: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended. Many troops are not needed anymore and have been sent home again. Maybe we could hire some of them.
TEXT.Spanish: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended. Many troops are not needed anymore and have been sent home again. Maybe we could hire some of them.

TEXT.English: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.
TEXT.French: Íàì íóæåí äåéñòâèòåëüíî îïûòíûé ãåíåðàë, ÷òîáû âåñòè íàøè âîéñêà.
TEXT.German: Wir brauchen einen erfahrenen General um unserer Truppen zu führen.
TEXT.Italian: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.
TEXT.Spanish: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.

TEXT.English: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.
TEXT.French: Âîçìîæíî ìû â ñîñòîÿíèè íàíÿòü íåìíîãî ýëèòíûõ âîéñê.
TEXT.German: Vielleicht gelingt es uns einige Elitetruppen zu rekrutieren.
TEXT.Italian: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.
TEXT.Spanish: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.

TEXT.English: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî âåòåðàíîâ âåñüìà ïîñïîñîáñòâóþò óêðåïëåíèþ íàøèõ âîîðóæåííûõ ñèë.
TEXT.German: Einige Veterane um unsere Truppen zu stärken, wäre sicherlich nicht verkehrt.
TEXT.Italian: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.
TEXT.Spanish: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.
TEXT.French: Â íàñòîÿùåå âðåìÿ ìû íå ìîæåì ìîçâîëèòü ñåáå èíâåñòèðîâàòü âîåíùèíó.
TEXT.German: Wir können es uns momentan nicht leisten für mehr Truppen Geld auszugeben.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.

TEXT.English: A drunken fisher died in a storm.
TEXT.French: Ïüÿíûé ðûáàê ïîãèá â øòîðìå.
TEXT.German: Ein betrunkener Fischer starb in einem Sturm.
TEXT.Italian: A drunken fisher died in a storm.
TEXT.Spanish: A drunken fisher died in a storm.

TEXT.English: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.
TEXT.French: Ïüÿíûé ðûáàê óïàë çà áîðò âî âðåìÿ øòîðìà è óòîíóë. Òåïåðü åãî âäîâà õî÷åò ïðîäàòü ðûáàöêóþ ëîäêó, íå íàéäÿ åé èíîãî ïðèìåíåíèÿ.
TEXT.German: Ein betrunkener Fischer fiel während eines Sturms über Bord und ertrank. Seine Witwe möchte nun dessen Fischerboot verkaufen, da sie keine Verwendung dafür hat.
TEXT.Italian: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.
TEXT.Spanish: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.

TEXT.English: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.
TEXT.French: Ìû ïîìîæåì áåäíîé âäîâå è êóïèì åå ëîäêó çà õîðîøóþ öåíó.
TEXT.German: Wir werden der Witwe helfen und das Boot zu einem fairen Preis kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.
TEXT.Spanish: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.

TEXT.English: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.French: Íàì î÷åíü æàëü, íî ýòî íå íàøå äåëî.
TEXT.German: Das ist zwar traurig, betrifft uns aber nicht.
TEXT.Italian: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.Spanish: This is sad, but it is not our business.

TEXT.English: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.
TEXT.French: Ìÿñíèê ïîêèíóë Åâðîïó èççà îáâèíåíèÿ â ïðîäàæå òóõëîãî ìÿñà.
TEXT.German: Ein Schlachtermeister ist aus Europa geflohen, weil er verdorbenes Fleisch verkauft haben soll.
TEXT.Italian: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.
TEXT.Spanish: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.

TEXT.English: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.
TEXT.French: Ìÿñíèê ïðèáûë â ãàâàíü îäíîãî èç íàøèõ ãîðîäîâ. Åìó ïðèøëîñü áåæàòü èç Åâðîïû ïîñêîëüêó åãî îáâèíÿëè â ïðîäàæå òóõëîãî ìÿñà. Îí ñ÷èòàåò ÷òî íåâèíîâåí è ïðîñèò äàòü åìó âòîðîé øàíñ.
TEXT.German: Ein Schlachtermeister ist im Hafen einer unserer Städte eingetroffen. Er musste aus Europa fliehen, weil er verdorbenes Fleisch verkauft haben soll. Er behauptet aber unschuldig zu sein und bittet um eine zweite Chance.
TEXT.Italian: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.
TEXT.Spanish: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.

TEXT.English: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.
TEXT.French: Êàæäûé çàñëóæèâàåò âòîðîé øàíñ. Ïóñòü ðàáîòàåò ïî ñâîåé ñòàðîé ïðîôåññèè è çàïëàòèòå åâðîïåéñêèì âëàñòÿì, ïóñòü çàáóäóò îá èíöèäåíòå.
TEXT.German: Jeder verdient eine zweite Chance. Lasst den Mann in seinem alten Beruf arbeiten und bezahlt die Authoritäten in Europa diesen Vorfall zu vergessen.
TEXT.Italian: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.
TEXT.Spanish: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.

TEXT.English: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.French: Ìû ñäàäèì ýòîãî ÷åëîâåêà åâðîïåéñêèì âëàñòÿì.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diesen Mann der Authorität in Europa überstellen.
TEXT.Italian: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.

TEXT.English: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.
TEXT.French: Îò÷àÿííûå êîíêèñòàäîðû ñîâåðøèëè íàëåò íà ïîñåëîê òóçåìöåâ.
TEXT.German: Einige verzweifelte Conquistadores haben ein Ureinwohnerdorf überfallen.
TEXT.Italian: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.

TEXT.English: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.
TEXT.French: Çäîðîâî ïîòðåïàííûå êîííûå êîíêèñòàäîðû ïðèáûëè â îäèí èç íàøèõ íàñåëåííûõ ïóíêòîâ. Íåêîòîðûå èç íèõ ðàíåíû. Íåìíîãî ïîãîäÿ çàÿâèëèñü àáîðèãåíû èç ñîñåäíåãî ïëåìåíè è ïîæàëîâàëèñü íà êîíêèñòàäîðîâ ãðîìÿùèõ èõ äåðåâíè.
TEXT.German: Einige berittene Conquistadores in sehr schlechtem Zustand sind in einer unserer Siedlungen angekommen. Einige von ihnen sind verwundet. Kurz darauf trafen auch einige Ureinwohner eines nahegelegenen Stammes ein und beschuldigten die Conquistadores ihre Dörfer überfallen zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.

TEXT.English: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.
TEXT.French: Çàêîâàòü â öåïè ýòèõ ãîëîâîðåçîâ. Ìû íèêîãäà íå ñîâåðøàåì íàáåãîâ íà íàøèõ êðàñíîêîæèõ äðóçåé.
TEXT.German: Legt diesen Halsabschneidern ketten an. Niemand darf ungestraft unsere wilden Freunde angreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.
TEXT.Spanish: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.

TEXT.English: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.
TEXT.French: Ïðîñòî ýòè ëþäè áûëè â îò÷àÿííîì ïîëîæåíèè. Ìû ïðèñòðîèì èõ â íàøåé êîëîíèè è ïîäîáíîå íèêîãäà áîëüøå íå ïîâòîðèòñÿ.
TEXT.German: Die Männer waren schlicht verzweifelt. Wir werden sie in uneren Dienst stellen und Sorge tragen, dass so etwas nicht wieder vor kommt.
TEXT.Italian: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.
TEXT.Spanish: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.

TEXT.English: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.
TEXT.French: Ñïîðû ìåæäó îõîòíèêàìè è àáîðèãåíàìè çà ïðàâî îõîòû.
TEXT.German: Konflikte zwischen Trappern und Ureinwohnern über Jagdrechte.
TEXT.Italian: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.
TEXT.Spanish: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.

TEXT.English: Close to one of our forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.
TEXT.French: Íåïîäàëåêó îò îäíîãî èç íàøèõ ôîðòîâ áûëè ñëûøíû âûñòðåëû. ×àñòü ãðàíèçîíà, îòïðàâèâøàÿñÿ âûÿñíèòü ÷òî ñëó÷èëîñü, íàòêíóëàñü íà ïîâçäîðèâøèõ îõîòíèêîâ è òóçåìöåâ. Èíäåéöû óòâåðæäàþò ÷òî ëåñà ïî ïðåæíåìó ïðèíàäëåæàò òîëüêî èì è áåëûì íå ðàçðåøàåòñÿ òóò îõîòèòüñÿ.
TEXT.German: In der Nähe eines unserer Forts haben die Truppen Schüsse in den Wäldern gehört. Als sie diese untersuchten, fanden sie Ureinwohner und Trapper in eine Streit über Jagdrechte in den umliegenden Wäldern. Die Ureinwohner behaupten, dass das Land immer noch ihnen gehört und dass dort kein weisser Mann ohne ihre Erlaubnis jagen darf.
TEXT.Italian: Close to one of our forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.
TEXT.Spanish: Close to one of our Forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.

TEXT.English: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.French: Ïóñòü îõîòíèêè ïîêèíóò ëåñà. Ýòà çåìëÿ ïðèíàäëåæèò íàøèì êðàñíîêîæèì äðóçüÿì.
TEXT.German: Die Trapper sollen diese Wälder sofort verlassen. Sie gehören unseren wilden Freunden.
TEXT.Italian: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.Spanish: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.

TEXT.English: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.French: Ìû êóïèì ýòè ëåñà ó íàøèõ êðàñíîêîæèõ äðóçåé è íàéìåì îõîòíèêîâ ê ñåáå íà ñëóæáó.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diese Wälder kaufen und die Trapper für uns arbeiten lassen.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.

TEXT.English: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.
TEXT.French: Ãîëîâîðåçû áðîäÿò ïî ëåñó.
TEXT.German: Halsabschneider machen die Wälder unsicher.
TEXT.Italian: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.
TEXT.Spanish: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.

TEXT.English: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.
TEXT.French: Ìû ïîëó÷èëè äîíåñåíèÿ ÷òî ãîëîâîðåçû áðîäÿò ïî îêðåñòíûì ëåñàì. Ê ñ÷àñòüþ îäèí èç íàøèõ ôîðòîâ ðàñïîëîæåí ïîáëèçîñòè è ìû ìîæåì îòïðàâèòü ïàòðóëè.
TEXT.German: In der Nähe eines unserer Forts scheinen sich einige Halsabschneider in den Wäldern zu verstecken. Sollen unsere Truppen eingreifen ?.
TEXT.Italian: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.
TEXT.Spanish: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.

TEXT.English: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.
TEXT.French: Íàøè âîéñêà ïðåïîäàäóò ãîëîâîðåçàì óðîê êîòîðûé òå íå çàáóäóò. Ýòî äîæíî ñòàòü ïðåäîñòåðåæåíèåì äëÿ äðóãèõ ìðàçåé.
TEXT.German: Unsere Truppen sollen diesen Halsabschneidern eine Lektion erteilen. Dies soll auch eine Warnung an anderen Abschaum sein.
TEXT.Italian: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.
TEXT.Spanish: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.

TEXT.English: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.
TEXT.French: Ïîïûòàéòåñü íàéòè ýòè ïîòåðÿííûå äóøè, ìû äàäèì èì øàíñ âåðíóòüñÿ â öèâèëèçîâàííîå îáùåñòâî.
TEXT.German: Versucht diese armen Seelen zu finden und gebt ihnen eine Chance in die zivilisierte Gesellschaft zurückzukehren.
TEXT.Italian: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.
TEXT.Spanish: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.

TEXT.English: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.
TEXT.French: Ëþäè èç ãëóøè êóïèëè ïðèïàñû â ôîðòàõ.
TEXT.German: Männer in der Wildniss nutzen die Forts um Vorräte zu kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.
TEXT.Spanish: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.

TEXT.English: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî ëþäåé, æèâóùèõ â áëèçëåæàùåé ãëóøè, ïðèøëè â îäèí èç íàøèõ ôîðòîâ çàêóïèòüñÿ ïðèïàñàìè. Ïîõîæå îíè õîðîøî çíàþò ýòîò ðåãèîí è ìîãóò áûòü íàì ïîëåçíû.
TEXT.German: Einige Männer, die in der nahegelegenen Wildniss leben, sind in unser Fort gekommen um Vorräte zu kaufen. Es scheint als hätten sie sehr viel Wissen über die Gegend. Daher könnten sie uns sehr nützlich sein.
TEXT.Italian: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.

TEXT.English: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.French: ×òî æ, ïðîäàéòå èì òî çà÷åì îíè ïðèøëè.
TEXT.German: Dann verkauft ihnen die Vorräte, die sie wollen.
TEXT.Italian: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.

TEXT.English: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.French: Îíè íåñîìíåííî îòëè÷íûå ðàçâåä÷èêè. Íàéìèòå èõ.
TEXT.German: Sie wären us sicherlich als Kundschafter sehr dienlich.
TEXT.Italian: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.Spanish: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.

TEXT.English: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.French: Ïîïðîáóéòå óáåäèòü èõ ïðèñîåäèíèòüñÿ ê íàì â ðîëè ðåéíäæåðîâ.
TEXT.German: Versucht sie zu überzeugen unseren Truppen als Rangers zu dienen.
TEXT.Italian: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.Spanish: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.

TEXT.English: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.
TEXT.French: Ïîñëå äîëãîé è òðóäíîé çèìû, òóçåìöû ïðèøëè â ìîíàñòûðü ÷òîáû êóïèòü íåìíîãî åäû.
TEXT.German: Nach einem langen harten Winter kamen Ureinwohner in ein Kloster um Nahrung zu kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.
TEXT.Spanish: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.

TEXT.English: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.
TEXT.French: Ïîñëå äîëãîé è òðóäíîé çèìû, âûõîäöû èç ñîñåäíåé äåðåâíè ïðèøëè â îäèí èç íàøèõ ìîíàñòûðåé êóïèòü íåìíîãî åäû. Ó íèõ íåò äîñòàòî÷íî òîâàðîâ ÷òîáû ïðîèçâåñòè îáìåí.
TEXT.German: Nach einem langen harten Winter kamen Ureinwohner aus einem benachbarten Dorf in eines unserer Kloster um Nahrung zu kaufen. Sie haben aber im Austausch wenig anzubieten.
TEXT.Italian: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.

TEXT.English: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.French: Ïðîäàéòå èì ÷àñòü íàøåé åäû ïî ñïðàâåäëèâîé öåíå.
TEXT.German: Verkauft ihnen ein wenig unserer Nahrungsvorräte.
TEXT.Italian: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.

TEXT.English: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.French: Äàéòå èì ïîëîâèíó åäû êîòîðóþ ìû õðàíèì â áëèæàéøåì ãîðîäå, äàðîì.
TEXT.German: Schenkt ihnen die Hälfte der Nahrungsvorräte der am Nächsten gelegenen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.Spanish: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.

TEXT.English: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.French: Ýòà çèìà áûëà òðóäíîé è äëÿ íàñ â òîì ÷èñëå. Ìû íå ìîæåì ïîäåëèòüñÿ ïðîäóêòàìè.
TEXT.German: Es war auch für uns ein harter Winter. Wir können keine Nahrung erübrigen.
TEXT.Italian: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.Spanish: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.

TEXT.English: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî èíäåéöåâ ñáåæàëè îò ðàáîâëàäåëüöà è èùóò ïðèþò â ìîíàñòûðÿõ.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohnersklaven entfliehen der Gefangenschaft des Weissen Mannes und suche Schutz in Klöstern.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.

TEXT.English: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî ðàáîâ-èíäåéöåâ ñáåæàëè îò îäíîãî èç íàøèõ åâðîïåéñêèõ ñîñåäåé è èùóò çàùèòû â ìîíàñòûðÿõ. Âîéñêà ''ñîñåäåé'' îêðóæèëè íàø ìîíàñòûðü è òðåáóþò âåðíóòü èõ ñîáñòâåííîñòü.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohnersklaven konnten der Gefangenschaft eines unserer europäischen Nachbarn entfliehen und suchen nun Schutz in einem unserer Klöstern. Truppen unseres Nachbarn haben aber bereits das Kloster umstellt und verlangen die Herausgabe der Sklaven.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.

TEXT.English: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.French: Âåðíèòå ðàáîâ íàøèì åâðîïåéñêèì ñîñåäÿì. Ýòî èõ ïðàâî.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen dem Gesetz Folge leisten und die Sklaven wieder unserem Nachbarn übergeben.
TEXT.Italian: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.

TEXT.English: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.French: Ýòè ðàáû òåïåðü íàøè. Èõ õîçÿåâà íå ðèñêíóò íàïàñòü íà ìîíàñòûðü.
TEXT.German: Die Sklaven gehören nun uns. Unser Nachbar wird es nicht wagen ein Kloster anzugreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.Spanish: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.

TEXT.English: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.
TEXT.French: Ìû êóïèì ýòèì çàáëóäøèì äóøàì ñâîáîäó è äàäèì èì øàíñ íà íîâóþ æèçíü, ñâîáîäíûõ ëþäåé.
TEXT.German: Wird werden die Sklaven freikaufen und ihnen eine Chance geben wieder als freie Menschen zu leben.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.

TEXT.English: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.
TEXT.French: Òóçåìöû ïðèíåñëè â ìîíàñòûðü ðàíåííîãî âîèíà.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner brachten Verwundeten in ein Kloster.
TEXT.Italian: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.

TEXT.English: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.
TEXT.French: Íåñêîëüêî èíäåéöåâ, èç ñîñåäíåé äåðåâíè, ïðèíåñëè òÿæåëî ðàíåííîãî ìîëîäîãî âîèíà â îäèí èç íàøèõ ìîíàñòûðåé. Ïîõîæå åãî àòàêîâàë ìåäåâåäü. Åñëè ìû íå ïîìîæåì åìó, îí íàâåðíÿêà óìðåò.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohner eines nahegelegen Dorfes haben einen schwer verwundeten jungen Krieger in eines unserer Klöster gebracht. Er scheint vom einem Bären angegriffen worden zu sein. Wenn wir nicht helfen, wird er sterben.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.

TEXT.English: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.French: Êîíå÷íî æå ìû ïîìîæåì. Ïîïûòàéòåñü ñòàáèëèçèðîâàòü åãî ñîñòîÿíèå. Ìû íåìåäëåííî ïîøëåì çà äîêòîðîì.
TEXT.German: Natürlich werden wir helfen. Versucht ihn zu stabilisieren, bis ein Arzt mit Medikamenten eintrifft.
TEXT.Italian: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.Spanish: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.

TEXT.English: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.
TEXT.French: Ìû ïîìîæåì ýòîìó ìîëîäîìó âîèíó. Íî ñêàæèòå òóçåìöàì, ïóñòü â îáìåí ïðèíåñóò íåìíîãî åäû â íàø áëèæàéøèé ãîðîä.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem jungen Kriegern helfen. Als Gegenleistung sollen die Ureinwohner aber etwas Nahrung in unsere nächste Stadt schicken.
TEXT.Italian: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.

TEXT.English: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.French: Ñäåëàéòå âñå âîçìîæíîå ÷òîáû ñïàñòè åìó æèçíü. Åñëè æå îí âûæèâåò, íàïîìíèòå åìó î êðîâíîì äîëãå ïåðåä íàìè.
TEXT.German: Tut was immer ihr könnt um sein Leben zu retten. Wenn er überlebt, erinnert ihn daran dass er uns gegenüber eine Blutschuld trägt.
TEXT.Italian: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.

TEXT.English: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Ïåðâûé óíèâåðñèòåò áûë îñíîâàí â %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die erste Universität der Neuen Welt wurde in %s2_city gegründet.
TEXT.Italian: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: An influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.
TEXT.French: Âëèÿòåëüíîå ñîîáùåñòâî îáðàçîâàííûõ ëþäåé íà íàøåé ðîäèíå, óñëûøàëè îá îñíîâàíèè ïåðâîãî óíèâåðñèòåòà. Îíè õîòÿò ïîìî÷ü íàì, îòïðàâèâ âûñîêî îáðàçîâàííîãî ÷åëîâåêà ðàáîòàòü â êà÷åñòâå ïðîôåññîðà.
TEXT.German: Eine einflussreiche Gesellschaft gebildeter Männer unseres Heimatlandes hat von der Gründung unserer ersten Universität erfahren. Sie wollen uns helfen, indem sie uns einen hoch gebildeten Mann schicken wollen, der unsere Studenten unterrichtet.
TEXT.Italian: A influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.
TEXT.Spanish: A influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.

TEXT.English: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.
TEXT.French: Ìû ìîãëû áû íàíÿòü êîãî-òî, ÷òîáû îáó÷àòü íàøèõ ñòóäåíòîâ ïîëèòèêå.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten jemanden gebrauchen, der unsere Studenten in Politik unterrichtet.
TEXT.Italian: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.
TEXT.Spanish: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.

TEXT.English: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.
TEXT.French: Ïðèãëàñèòå òåîëîãà. Ðåëèãèÿ ïðåâûøå âñåãî.
TEXT.German: Fragt nach einem Theologen. Religion ist wichtig.
TEXT.Italian: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.
TEXT.Spanish: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.

TEXT.English: What we need most is a medical doctor.
TEXT.French: Ïðåæäå âñåãî ìû íóæäàåìñÿ âî âðà÷å.
TEXT.German: Was wir am meisten benötigen ist ein Mediziner.
TEXT.Italian: What we need most is a medical doctor.
TEXT.Spanish: What we need most is a medical doctor.

TEXT.English: That is very friendly of our Native neighbours. Send them some food from the nearest city to thank them.
TEXT.French: Ýòî î÷åíü ìèëî ñî ñòîðîíû íàøèõ èíäåéñêèõ ñîñåäåé. Îòïðàâüòå èì íåìíîãî åäû èç áëèæàéøåãî ãîðîäà, â áëàãîäàðíîñòü.
TEXT.German: Das ist sehr nachbarschaftlich von unseren Ureinwohnerfreunden. Schickt ihnen zum Dank etwas Nahrung aus einer nahegelegenen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: That is very friendly of our Native neighbours. Send them some food from the nearest city to thank them.
